Reviews.Title: “Silverton-good off the strip casino”
Reviews.Author: okgolou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoy going to this casino/hotel. Our favorite bartender is Tom. He looks out for us on our trips. We usually stay 3 or 4 nights, before or after timesharing in Vegas. Our favorite dinner restaurant is Twin Creeks, I personally like the twin lobster tails. The coffee shop is great for breakfast as well as something light at night. I like the size of the casino for getting around. The ambiance is southwestern, which is to our liking. The machines are pretty loose. My husband likes craps. Sometime, in the early part of the week, the tables are not very busy, he likes more of a crowd. Weekends are better for craps. A great local casino. We have been to a lot of the casino/hotels on the strip or just off the strip, but I like it at Silverton. As we get older, some of the larger strip casinos are a bit too large for us to move around. Silverton is rather compact, but great.

Reviews.Title: “Boy, we where let down”
Reviews.Author: EdBroadfield
Reviews.Content: I didn't get a cheap deal ,com. I called the Silverton and made my reservation. 3 Mths in advance. Told them I wanted a upper floor with a view. Nice lady said sureee. When we got there. They want to put us on ground floor. She finally put us on 2nd floor. View was a wall. I remembered this place as being real special. It wasn't now. I should have known, when we walked in and saw the dirty fish tank. Carpet was dirty, really dirty. Safe didn't work. We called and ask for a blanket. They took it to wrong room, finally got it. Counter in bath room had holes in it. Wall paper in bath was peeling off, probably becouse there was no fan. When shower ran it made a load squeeling noice. Night stands looked like they where from goodwell. Couch too. The sheet where to small, if you moved, they came untucked. The ice machine didn't work, when I ask the maide, she real said I don't know, that is not my job. If you are looking for a nice place, this is not it...

Reviews.Title: “A little annoying”
Reviews.Author: AZMaverick
Reviews.Content: Our second visit. 1. On checking in we were asked to sign a confirmation that we would not smoke in the room. We are non-smokers. As soon as we got through the room door, I found an empty packet of cigarettes in the waste bin. This suggested either that we were being stitched up for a fine or that the housekeeping staff were pretty poor at their inspection jobs. Reported it to the Front Desk. 2. We came to run the bathtub and found that the water was running out almost as fast as it was going in despite the fact that the antiquated plug system had been applied. Reported it to the Front Desk who assured us that it would be seen to. Not during our two day stay it wasn't - and probably still not. 3. We booked direct and the web page picture showed us a room with a flat screen TV. Our room had a really old TV with a corresponding poor quality picture. Front Desk told us that this was obviously a come-on and that those rooms with a flat screen TV were $30 a night extra. Beware when you consider a booking! No compensation offered on checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: alchaffee
Reviews.Content: Checked in the day before St. Patrick's Day. The hotel was sold out. We expected a line for check in but were surprized to find none. The rooms are typical hotel fare,clean and comfortable but nothing special. Good bedding and matresses. Small bath and tub/shower. The Casino is very large with plenty of different things to do. Lots of table games and slots. The aquarium at the main entrance is spectacular! Many different kinds of salt water fish like sharks and sting rays. The attached Bass Pro Shop was the icing on the cake for the guys.The on site dining options are good (johnny rockets burgers and malts,buffet,fast food italian,mexican dining,casual grill,steakhouse and an ice cream counter). Employees were all great and very helpfull. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Silverton Drops the Ball”
Reviews.Author: Schofield73
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a Nascar package through the Silverton in Vegas. The hotel was pretty good and the staff was helpful. However our experience travelling to and from the track on Sunday, which the hotel supplied, was not good. The bus driver took the wrong bus and we had to park in the wrong lot at the track. This resulted in a mile long walk around the track to our seats and back again after the race. Then we were stuck at the track after to wait for 2 people to show up. Instead of sending us on our way and getting a cab for those people we had to wait until we had enough and forced them to take us back to the hotel. As a result of this delay we missed the shuttle to the strip where we had dinner plans. The hotel informed us that they could get us a cab but we would have to pay for it ourselves. There was no attempt to remedy this situation or even ask us if there was any way to redeem the hotel for their mistake. After having a note put on my account that I was not happy with the situation the hotel has failed to contact me and it is now 5 days after our stay. I would not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, rooms need renovation”
Reviews.Author: Will C
Reviews.Content: The Silverton Hotel and Casino is an alternate choice for those who do not want to spend too much money in a room. The casino is impressively huge, and the fish tank with the mermaid show is also impressive. However, the rooms need to be renovated, as they are outdated. Come on Silverton, even though you offer affordable prices, there are plentiful of better hotels that are worth spending a bit more money at.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable priced casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: ewelzien
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Silverton this past weekend. The price was very resonable, hotel room, was nice, the cafe was great but the service in the casino was horrible. When drink orders were taken I was asked everytime if I was gambling at a machine. I felt as if I was being watched constantly to make sure I was gambling. It left a very uneasy feeling with us, so we gambled elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: suziq2Texas
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here I was a little worried about our trip.We stayed in a luxury King room. I believe they are the newest ones. It was spotless and clean and contemporary..i loved it and I am picky. bed was extremely comfortable. Bathroom had granite countertops and large walk in shower. above all...it looked new, smelled new and was impeccably clean. The staff was incredibly friendly. Other travelers complained of noise. The only noise I heard was other guest slamming their doors. we were on the first floor which was 15 second walk to casino...i loved that...casino not as big as the strip ones but that is what i loved about it. They do have 3 and 5 dollar tables. Food selection during the day was a little limited...a full service restaurant called sundance open 24/7, a burger place, a fast food italian place....at 4 all the other restaurants and bars started serving food an appetizers...would have been nice to have more selections earlier. The aquarium is awesome. Im not a "buffet" person so probably not the best person to review it but i thought it was just "OK". Nothing special. Friendly bar service and wait staff. dealers at casino nice and friendly...not stuffy like some on the strip. Overall I was very pleased and will definitely stay at the silveron again in a luxury king room. Please message me for any specific questions.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller and more local feel”
Reviews.Author: Meezermeister
Reviews.Content: Nice property with a more local feel than the bigger casinos but not a dive at all. Love the Bass Pro shop and all the aquariums. Gambling floor nice size. The buffet is a nice value especially when they have special deals on.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable priced local casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: DT808
Reviews.Content: The hotel casino seems to be frequented by mostly locals. I like the location south of the strip off of Blue Diamond Road. it is the closest nicest casino to the rental car center and factory outlet mall. There is a Target and a In-N-Out Burgers across the street. The adjoining Bass Shop is an enjoyable side trek when you need a break. The dealers are generally friendly and the casino never appears to be overcrowded. Oh yes, perhaps I was tired, but the bed was raised and extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Susiemac66
Reviews.Content: Casino very clean not gross and stinky like most. I hate the smell,of cigarettes and it was not bad at all. The restaurants were all great though I have to say Mexican one was my least favorite. The Mexican food was very americanized. I wouldn't bother trying that again. The Buffett was delish and I am not a fan of buffets. The Sundance was great. The customer service was good. The beds were comfy, the rooms were very clean, though the walls were pretty thin. Nice place to stay off the strip. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingFarmer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times over the last few years, what keeps us coming back is the easy parking and friendly staff. We don't gamble much, we tend to spend our money at the Bass Pro Shop, which is worth the stop by itself. The sunset grill has great food and we have never had to wait to be seated. The only con was our shower drain was plugged, watch that if you stay in 3080!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: nancyhbronx
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The rooms are very clean & have plenty of space so you don't feel cramped. The bed was very comfortable. The casino is generous when it comes to slots and you can earn a free buffet dinner very easily. We tried most of their restaurants and the food was excellent and reasonably priced. The average meal for 2 came out to $25. They serve Starbucks coffee at the Sundance Grill - which is the equivelant to a diner and the variety was astounding. Johnny Rockets was a fun spot for burgers and shakes. We ate at the buffet on Friday night where they serve surf & turf with unlimited snow crab legs and prime rib. The outdoor pool area is a pleasant place to sit & enjoy some fresh air even if you don't feel like using the pool. Another added bonus is the huge Pro Bass shop attached to the resort, especially for any outdoor enthusiasts. They had a waterfall with a fishpond & ducks. There were also some gun & archery ranges. Next door to the Pro Bass store is a beautiful giant aquarium & if you go there at the right time you can watch a scuba diver feed the sharks. For those of you who enjoy Las Vegas, but can do without stayng on the strip, this is a nice choice. We were only ten minutes from the strip when we wanted to drive there. Please consider taking a trip to Red Rock and Valley of Fire Parks in the area. They are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not as pictured, just ok”
Reviews.Author: livestrong64
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Silverton for a softball tournament. The rooms don't look anything like the pictures, at least ours didn't. Kind of like a poor attempt to fix up an old Motel 6 and make it look like a dude ranch. Not modern at all. Bathroom too small for two people, tv very old. The bed was comfortable and the room fairly roomy. Front desk very nice. Loved the Mermaid Bar and the fish tank. Silverton Grill was good for breakfast, but would not recommend eating there any other time. Don't understand the long wait when the place was almost empty. Wish there was a coffee maker in the room. I hate cigarette smoke and the casino and bar area were pretty well ventilated. We did get the room we requested, but others in our group did not. They also charge your card for one night when you make your reservation, which I did not like but didn't have a choice. For the price I guess it was ok, but when in Vegas I would much rather pay a little more for a nicer, newer room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonsUT
Reviews.Content: We made a prepaid reservation at this hotel 2 months in advance of our 2/11 stay. We paid for a deluxe king room. On 2/11 we called the hotel when we realized our flight delays would get us to the hotel very late. The front desk assured us that a deluxe king non-smoking room had been assigned and would be held for us. When we arrived we were put in a handicapped 2 double beds room. The front desk told us there was nothing they could do, because we checked in late and the hotel was full. The room was ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING!!!! The carpets were sticky and so dirty with stains. The bathroom was for a wheel chair so when you sat on the toilet your feet did not touch the floor and the shower was disgusting. No water pressure, the shower curtain should have been burned a long time ago to kill the stains and mildew. The only way to shower was really to sit down on the drop seat. We could hear every conversation in the rooms on each side of us and on top of us. The attitude of the hotel front desk and the fact that we had prepaid for a deluxe king room 2 months in advance and the hotel not wanting to do any thing at all was the icing on the cake to the DISGUSTING room. There are too many hotels in Vegas to accept the type of service (or lack of it) that we did at this hotel. Save your time and money and try a different place to stay than here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, but some hidden irritations”
Reviews.Author: flattops
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights here in early February on combination business/pleasure trip. On the positive side, the rooms were clean, roomy and very quiet. In fact, the insulation was fantastic and with a room fan on, we never heard noise from adjoining rooms or people in the hallways. The beds were soft and very comfortable, and they give you plenty of pillows. The bathroom was a little cramped for two people, but had plenty of counter space, and they supply you with an abundance of towels and wash cloths. Water pressure was great and the temperature was hot and consistent. The only major drawback was the ceiling fan did not work, so things got very steamy and no way to clear the mirrors efficiently. We did have one scare when some terrible gurgling noises occurred in the bathroom and we went in to find water backing up in the sink. We called the front desk and they sent a maintenance crew up, but the water went down on its own and they seemed to think they had a larger problem affecting the entire wing, not just our room. No harm, no foul, but we kept things up off the floor just in case. We did notice repaired water damage on our ceiling and wall where they've apparently had plumbing issues in the past, but again, there was no real inconvenience to us. This is a typical casino/resort set up, so you have to maneuver through a myriad of gambling just to get to the front desk and of course you must drag your luggage throught the same maze in order to get to your room. I understand the design philosophy of casinos, but that doesn't make it less annoying when you are road-weary and just want to quietly get to a bed. However, the most irritating part of our visit was twofold: 1) Hidden "resort fees" that they tack on to your billing. About $5/day, which ostensibly gives you access to the pool, the workout room, local calls, etc. These are all things which "normal" hotels simply provide in the room base price, so why not adjust the room rates accordingly rather than hitting guests with hidden fees? That is poor business practice in my opinion. 2) They provide WiFi capability, but only for an additional fee of $10.99/day. Simple internet service, which is pretty much a free standard for decent hotels across the planet, is a premium-priced luxury at the Silverton. I have to admit, that irritated me a lot. But not to worry--the Starbucks in the downstairs casino is true to that company's form--they offer free WiFi, so we used Starbucks instead. Still very aggravating to be unable to handle emails/etc from the comfort of your room without paying an extortion price. Overall, nice facilities, and friendly staff, but they just can't seem to let go of Vegas' gangster image by sticking it to you for something.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bmahaffey
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here while in Vegas. It was great. We was away from the noise but yet transported anywhere we wanted to go. We will return, Rooms clean and staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: jennyjenn73
Reviews.Content: Couldn't sleep because of all the noise. Walls and floor so thin we could hear conversation in the next room, walking in the room above us. After 2 nights, checked out and went to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel Off Strip But Very Nice Casino”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 2 times...each stay one night each. This is not a place you would want to stay for a vacation, but for a night or a 2 night weeknd, it could fit the bill. Offstrip, about 15 minutes. Casino IS very nice, with ALOT of good slot games and tables. Mostly locals. Mermaid Bar in the front lobby area is very nice...right by the large fish tank and has good service, drinks & lite food. Buffet is good too. We went on a Sat. night...it included wine as well for about $20.00 a person. How can you beat that price and the food was good. Other restaurnats are on site...steak house & Mexican. Rooms are VERY dark and resemble an outdoor motel/lodge. They do not fit with the nice casino/lobby/bar/restaurant decor which is new & inviting. The entire room, bed, linens, towels...well, they do kinda make you feel dirty. A/C is LOUD...and has no real controls on it. It seems it is hot in the room even if it is in winter. Pool is small for the size of the place with not that many chairs. Near a major freeway. We have never gone out, but I would think noise could be a real problem. They have LOUD concerts some evenigs, but, lukily, we were never bothered. Again, casino is great...we VERY much enjoy it. Say a night or 2 at most.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: BeatleB
Reviews.Content: The Silverton Hotel may not be the most plush, but it is definitely a great value for your dollar. The beds are probably the most comfortable that I have ever slept on. I was quite surprised how busy they were mid week but that only added to the fun. They have all kinds of promotions to accommodate everyone. Good time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel off the strip..........”
Reviews.Author: UtahShunpiker
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and the clerk was very pleasant. We had a smonking room with a not so great view of an alley way and building wall, but oh well. Didn't spend much time in the room anyway so it was no great loss. Outdoorsy decor with heavy wood trim. Nice shower with good pressure and plenty of hot water. Fan on the AC unit was a bit loud. Lots of clean towels. No unpleasant finds in the room. Smelled musty, but it was a smoking room so to be expected. Conveniently located right off the freeway, out of the hub bub. Easy underground self parking. It seemed there was alot of noise coming from above our room. Sounded like elephants tromping around until 3 am. Overall we would recommend this place because of the convenience, there are four restaurants on site, plus a big casino with great comps!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: riklyns
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week-long stay at the Silverton Casino and it was great. The Shuttle to the airport and to the strip was complimentary. Starbucks coffee is served free on the Casino floor. The beds were comfy and clean. We had a quick check-in and there is not alot of walking from the parking garage to your room. The hotel was very generous with their food comps as I don't think we paid for many meals. A plus is a huge discount, designer shopping mall nearby. We didn't come across any cranky employees here. The only thing I would suggest is that they open up a gift shop. Although it is attached to a Bass Pro Shop, they don't sell anything I would be interested in. The Bath and Body Works products in the rooms make you feel a little special. The slot returns were about average. We did rent a car for a few days and the traffic is not bad at this end of Las Vegas Blvd. We would recommend this hotel to our family and friends and we will definitely look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: tcunder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights at the Silverton in October 2011. It was a great experience, from check-in to check-out. All of the staff were friendly and cordial. We enjoyed the casino, the restaurants, the pool and the hotel promotions to keep you on the property. By the way, a huge Bass Pro Shop is acessible directly from the hotel. The hotel is near the airport and major highways as well as Las Vegas Blvd. are just a short distance away. For the money, this is a great place to stay. The Silverton offers most of the amenities on a smaller scale and less hassle than a "Strip" hotel. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice room”
Reviews.Author: RetTravelers
Reviews.Content: The room was nice but the view was pretty sad - a block wall - the back of the Bass Pro about 6 feet away. The room was pretty dark all day. The room was large, had a love seat couch, older TV, desk and 2 chairs, very comfortable bed and ok bathroom. We had to be there for a wedding on Veterans Day weekend so were thankful to get a pretty good rate considering the gazillion people who were in Vegas that weekend and the increased charges at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Beautiful Renovated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JSanc58374
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed 1 night which was actually comped on Oct. 22nd, 2011. The checkin Process was quick and the room was centrally located near the Sundance Grille. The room was huge, with newly upgraded linen, Flat-Screen TV, sitting area, and drawer space for our clothes. The only negative I have, the bathroom was small. But it worked for us. Lastly, the weather was nice, and the pool was available. The cabanas were open and free to use, so we were able to take advantage of these. The pool is small, but the surrounding area was beautiful with flowers and Palm Trees. I will definitely stay here again, Comped or to pay. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: shoeindynutz29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Silverton for 4 nights in October 2011. Would just like to say we were more than pleased with our stay here. Check in on a Friday night was a breeze. The staff was just about the friendliest we have ever encountered. The food choices were excellent. One downer was the buffet. Most definitely needs someone to fix the food selection and quality. Dessert selection was probably the most uninspiring I have ever come across. Other than that... The Silverton is a beautiful casino set a short distance from the strip. It's not much of an inconvenience as the hotel offers a great little shuttle that brings you to and from center strip at Caesars Palace. If a cab is desired to return to the Silverton then its a $20 bill. Considering the cost difference between staying at a strip hotel or the silverton, the $20 cab ride is excellent. We found the strip can be on the stressful side, particularly on this trip, and the Silverton provided an excellent sanctuary to retreat to in the evenings. The rooms were clean, spacious, and very comfortable. House keeping was perfect and quite friendly. The pool was perfect. It's small but has great ambiance to relax with a drink, listen to really great rock music which was piped in through garden speakers, and chat up other guests. The attached Bass Pro Shop is an fantastic destination to spend some time. Outdoors-men or not... This place will amaze everyone, so be sure to check it out! As far as gaming, although we were non winners this trip, the Silverton allowed us to play long periods of time on our dollars as opposed to the cash Black Holes of the giant strip hotel casinos. Getting a cocktail while playing was also a breeze which is important to me since I believe that if I cant catch a royal flush... I can at least catch a buzz! HA HA! My wife and I would certainly recommend a stay at Silverton to anyone and everyone. Happy Gambling!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite (non-strip) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JunnyD
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for the past 5 years I guess. The rooms are very nice, but the mattresses are extraordinarily comfortable. Their buffet is more than adequate with a special one nite a week dinner for seniors of $5, you cannot beat that. Just make sure you sign up for the Slot Club card as a senior. One benefit that this hotel has is that you don't have to wait 'til 3 PM to check in. If there's a room available, you can check in when you arrive, period. They have a Bass Pro shop that is huge and has waterfalls and real ducks and fish and some good sale prices. Their casino is very nice for a smaller venue. For me, a major attraction is that their location is real close to the strip without the stiffling hordes of pedestrians and traffic jams of the strip. They have a few restaurants, no big celebrity chef named places, but nevertheless very nice. And a 24 hour Starbuck's right off the casino floor, what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: lulubelle1027
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Vegas for just one night and the Silverton was recommended to us by a friend that lives in Vegas. The hotel is off the strip but only a couple of minutes away. Our friend suggested we use the Valet service which we did and didn't have to wait more than 5 min. each time they went to get our car and usually less than that. The front desk was great. We walked right up (instead of waiting in a long line as we do at the hotels on the strip) and were concerned that we may not get a non smoking room because when we called we were told they don't book the room until you get there. No problem though, we were told they had rooms available on three different floors. We asked for the nicest room and had a great pool view from the 4th floor. Our room had two queen beds that were very comfortable. The room also had a fully stocked fridge with Beer, Wine and Energy Drinks. The front desk saw that we brought water and said we can remove some of the drinks from the fridge to put our waters in because they aren't magnetized and we won't be charged unless we drink their drinks. Also, the desk in the room had a basket with a good selection of candy, chips, etc. and prices on the drinks and snacks were very reasonable. The room was very clean. The room and floor we were on does look a little old and is definitely not flashy but everything was in good repair and clean. We didn't go to any of the bigger restaurants but did go to Johnny Rockets and Starbucks and the service at both places was great. This is definitely a place for the older crowd and my husband and I are both 49 and really liked it. There isn't a lot for kids to do here besides the pool and the aquarium but the strip is very close. The room was a great price through Expedia and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dirkdiggler18
Reviews.Content: For those of you who would like to visit Las Vegas and think you can't afford it, try Silverton, less than one mile off the strip and well worth the deviation. Outstanding hotel, buffet and casino along with a beautiful venue and a Bass Pro Shop that will literally "knock your socks off." It looks sort of like a "Huntington Lodge" but is so much more. The rooms are very comfortable, a beautiful pool area and great rates. I would return to this resort-xasino-hotel without reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Good, lots of smokers.....”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP78
Reviews.Content: The beds were very comfortable. The rooms were nice. The casino itself was extremely smoky and it just seemed like there were cigarettes everywhere. Service at the restaurants was very slow. Price was excellent. They hit you with a resort fee which is a scam because other than a pool, there is no resort. It is very far from the strip and the shuttle rarely runs-- it only goes to the strip 2-3 times per day. The best part about it was the $3.00 blackjack :-). Go somewhere else first though if you're visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - not only dirty but abused room!”
Reviews.Author: Qaquacker
Reviews.Content: We needed a room on the Saturday night of the iheart radio night and everything was outrageously priced. We decided Silverton was probably our best bet because of the price point being around $59 for a Saturday night stay with our Gold Players Club Card (yes we are Gold players and had to pay for our room? We are comped rooms all over the strip but had to pay for it here...go figure). I am a firm believer in reviews so I checked a few out and it seemed great. Anyway- we were assigned a room on ground level which was very different for us but it was close to the pool so hey - it's fine, right? OMG - no it wasn't fine. We opened the door, or at least what was left of the door and what we found was filth from top to bottom. It was awful. We were going to the Styx and Reo Speedwagon concert and were already behind schedule so we sucked it up, changed and left. What was the shocker was when we came back and found out the drapes didn't close. Remember we are on ground level by the pool area and the drapes don't close -YIKES. Needless to say, we checked out first thing in the AM and moved over to the Luxor...comped! Never again will we stay (or gamble for that matter) at the Silverton! Check out my pics to get the full impact of our story...

Reviews.Title: “Week without problems”
Reviews.Author: Dana143
Reviews.Content: I was in town for my son's wedding. I had to book 3 rooms at different times, my room made 4. It was a logistics nightmare people coming in different days, leaving on one day and coming back another. The reservation desk was wonderful as well as the front desk. They got to know me by name and face because of all the room changes. They were all pleasant to me and the others in the party as well. I have stayed at the Silverton before and have always considered it a great place to stay...a plus, I won enough on a penny slot to pay for the week.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Property and Great Casino”
Reviews.Author: keno777
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife the last week of August. Our room was on the first floor was just around the corner from the pool which we loved. The room and amenities seemed fairly new and were very comfortable. We had a view of the pool. Since we stayed during the week the hotel and casino were fairly quiet. The pool was so relaxing after the thumping music of the strip pools. Most of the strip pools are designed for 20 somethings with a cold beer in their hands with trunks half off. This pool was sooo relaxing with a nice hot tub too. A couple of nice girls (with major tatoos) to bring you drinks if you want. There were only 4-6 people at the pool at any one time and soft rock music. All of the 10 or so cabanas were unoccupied, and the price was reasonable if you want one for the day. We love Silverton. We had been to their casino a few times before buy never stayed there, and had a free room offer due to our play. I am happy we stayed there. We ate at the cafe twice because the buffet line was very long with locals. The breakfast and dinner we had were second to none. We paid with our points, and the steak and shrimp special with dessert was only like $14.99. One day while my wife shuttled her parents over to M Resort, I played all morning and ate at Johnny Rockets and devoured a huge burger and chocolate malt--pure heaven. I did win at the casino, getting a $1,600 W-2 on Cave Man Keno and hitting many smaller jackpots on four card Keno. Very nice atmosphere with continuous drink service. My wife won big on a penny machine called "Tarzan." She bought me shirts at the on site Bass Pro shop, which is very nice. I loved their big tanks equipped with Mermaids also. Silverton is a feel good, no nonsense property. Check in and out is a breeze, and they make you feel like a person and not a number. I can't wait to get back there. In my 55 trips to Vegas I have moved from mid-strip (Stardust & Westward Ho) to downtown to Orleans to all over the strip, but now will go out to my wan to stay at Silverton & the M Resort in Henderson, with Bellagio being my first stop. Yes we go on extended trips, but if you localize your gambling the offers will be better than if you scatter coins all over the city. I hope Silverton invites us back soon. Keno 77-Big Jim

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: haldane42
Reviews.Content: We did a road trip out west and this was by far the best room on the trip- the price was amazing and the hotel had a beautiful swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ErinL_H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here more than once - it is off the strip, but is close enough that it's still easy to get to, and there isn't the clogging of foot traffic that on-strip casinos often have. The pool has a lot of deck chairs and deck space, though the pool is on the small side. I did not gamble, but there are a lot of open slot machines and available seats at the tables - again, there isn't a need to fight massive crowds. The hotel is a few years old, but still feels new; even the casino doesn't have the lingering old-smoke smell that a lot of casino-hotels have.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: Marster11
Reviews.Content: This is the ideal location for a hotel in Vegas. We always rent a car so never an issue getting to the strip when you want to but it's a nice treat to get away from the crowds. The perks for joining the players club were great for the restaurants on location which had great food.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: yarmap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after a nine day trip thru Arizona and Utah before we flew home the next day. Our room was nicely decorated but with one problem...it had an odd smell but not bad enough to make a big thing of. The staff was friendly and efficient. The bed was the best I have ever slept in a hotel! The amenities and towels were plentiful and it was quiet. It is a small hotel and casino and easy to get around not like some of the largers ones where it takes 20 minutes or more to get in or out! Since it was our first visit to the Silverton we were given a free dinner buffet. We stood in line for over an hour and probably had another hour or longer to go so we gave it up. No food is worth that even if it is free. After a while we finally decided that one person would stand in line and then 4-8 people would then come up and get in line with them. That is not the Silverton's fault....just rude customers. We went to Johnny Rockets and the food and service was great. We would probably return to the Silverton.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: BeatleB
Reviews.Content: The location is good and it has all the amenities. Fun place for a family. Nice Casino and good choice of dinning. Large aquarium and attached to the Outdoor World Shop. The rooms are older, but the upkeep is good. Very cozy bed, (slept like a baby). Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Why lie?”
Reviews.Author: yakywally
Reviews.Content: We were traveling thru the area,called to see if they had availability, clerk says yes, (1) room, smoking. We don't smoke and wanted to think about it. My son loves BassPro, so we decided to stop. Front desk said no rooms available. I told him I had just spoke to someone and they said you have (1) room smoking. He talks to another clerk and VOILA, we have a room???? stayed 1 nite, won't go back. Even tho, it has only 4 floors, there are not enough elevators. If you go, do not check out even 5 minutes late, we were told they lock you out of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: vincent m
Reviews.Content: Well Worth the $45 for a weekday. Nice beds, clean. Pool area is nice. Kids even loved it. Wife wants to go back. They give you free meals, thats meals with an "s", when you sign up for there rewards card in the casino. Very nice if you want to stay out of all the crap on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Get away but close enough to the strip”
Reviews.Author: youngrose39
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed on the strip and were reluctent to stay off the strip, but a friend was staying there and so we decided to stay, what a surprise! We loved it.. Clean up to date, great food, great service, the pool was wonderful we rented a cabana for $25.00 for the day!! Normally its like $75.00 and up on the strip,They have cool bars and a bass shop on the other end Im not a fishing person but there was all kinds of other stuff in there to buy i got a new bathing suite waterfalls and if you dont want to drive they have a shuttle, they dont gouge, its simple but nice, I wouldnt get married there but would totally go back. we had such a good time we only went to the strip once. PS.. we stayed 3 days went home $40.00 less now thats a great time in Vegas .. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you do not like to sleep”
Reviews.Author: sidewinder747
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine until we went to bed and found the window A/C was SO LOUD. We asked for another room but were told all the rooms have this type A/C. Plus it has no temperature setting, just a know to turn it up or dwn. So you turn it up you are cold, down you are hot, somewhere in the middle and the machine kicks on and off. Every time it turns on or off you get the LOUD noise from the compressor. We moved the next morning went to Harrahs's and took a nap.

Reviews.Title: “Same old same old”
Reviews.Author: vetalex
Reviews.Content: I've been going to the Silverton for twelve years. I like the staff they are really friendly and helpful. There's a good choice of slots and table games too. Whilst the beds arev truly comfortable the rooms are still dark and dingy. And the showers are probably the worst I've used in any hotel anywhere! But I'll still go back there as I love the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, low stress”
Reviews.Author: RifleTraveller
Reviews.Content: I like the Silverton; it's located enough off the strip so that it's quiet and pleasant. Staff is very helpful and the rooms are a good bargain. I took three grandchildren with me, and it's an excellent choice for those with kids or older folks (like me) who don't want the amperage of the strip. Plus the decor is very much like Colorado. Nice place, but probably not for the 20 somethings. "Resort fee" an annoyance, and it doesn't include internet service (which is a pricey extra).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: kwilliams22a
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited the Silverton to gamble and eat at the Buffet. We took advantage of the player's club and got free slot play and Buffet. Marc at the player's club was very helpful and friendly. Maria at the Buffet was an amazing server. Very nice and very fast for how busy she was. The food was good and the price was right. I will be sure to return to the Silverton in the future. What a wonderful and staff, they managed to be friendly and helpful despite being very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay with ok value”
Reviews.Author: rkb777300
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and motel style with cooling unit connected to window and a bit noisy. Bathroom is small and shower/tub combo a bit worn. Plenty of towels an the bedding is actually quite comfortable. Pool area is nice. Resort fee of $7.50 per night is unwarranted as it is no resort and unless you use airport shuttle the fee has no value as it does not include Internet. Rates are decent but better location/value can be found with newer properties elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Bargain outside of the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: mare723
Reviews.Content: My parents and I decided to spend our Christmas vacation in beautiful Las Vegas. It had been a few years since the last time we had been to Vegas. We wanted to avoid the crush of tourists on the strip, so we booked 2 rooms at the Silverton Hotel & Casino, just outside of the strip. We were greeted warmly and were checked in quickly. Since my parents have some mobility issues they were able to accomodate them by making sure their rooms were closest to the elevator. Once there the rooms were very clean and the bedding was very comfortable, there was also a safe in the room which is always appreciated. The rooms have mini-bars and a snack tray with all sorts of goodies and CDs, but I'm sure it cost a pretty penny, so we didn't touch any of the items. The rooms were cleaned daily and the hotel staff always greeted us when they saw us. The hotel does have free WIFI, but it is only in their lobby area. The lobby area has very comfy leather chairs and there are electrical outlets behind the couches on the wall. Don't feel odd searching for outlets, there are other guests doing the same thing. The gym was smaller than I expected, it is not inside the hotel itself, you have to exit the hotel by a back door, walk down between the buildings and at the end of the building is the entrance to the gym. You have to have your room card with you. Towels are provided in the gym and there is a water cooler with paper cups. They have treadmills, ellipticals, and free wieghts. I noticed they also had mats and a couple of TVs. The restaurants at the hotel were nice. The buffet was plentiful and at the time they had a drink special, buy a souvenir beer glass for $5 get unlimited refills. Being the holidays, the staff was on top of bussing the tables, refilling drinks and keeping the line moving quickly. We also ate at the mexican restaurant at the hotel--there is only so much buffet you can handle in a week. The entrees seemed a bit pricey, but we wanted something different. The food was typical mexican/american fare, nothing spectacular. Afterwards we walked over to the gelato stand and had yummy gelatos. There's also a diner next to the gelato stand, which we also ate at, we were there for a whole week so yes we sampled a lot of what the Silverton had to offer. The diner was really nice, most importantly, our drinks and meals arrived promptly, refills were plentiful, and our server was very courteous. We also did a bit of shopping at the Bass Pro Shop, it was a nice distraction while waiting for the mermaid show to start in the huge tank, by the Mermaid Lounge. Overall, we really enjoyed our time here and would definitely recommnend it for anyone looking to stay in the Vegas area, but not on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM IN THE DESSERT”
Reviews.Author: Sentinel19
Reviews.Content: What a nice little gem in the dessert located just off Dean Martin Drive, south and west of the Strip (15 minutes from center Strip). My wife and I visited the Silverton casino (we stayed at the Palazzo) for the first time in June 2011. The property is fairly new and is very nice with a wilderness/outdoor/woodsy theme. If Yosemite had a casino, this would be it. The casino was very clean and was well maintained. Most of the tables have low $5 limits (getting harder to find on the Strip). Five dollar table limits in a really nice environment are a breath of fresh air. The air in the casino has a low smoke content. My wife and I played craps and Ultimate Texas Holdem and even $3, yes $3, blackjack (21). Cocktail service was often and the drinks are large and tasty. Make sure you sign up for their players card. They give you $5 credit at the slots and also a coupon for a free buffet when you sign up. We used the free buffet coupons the following day for the Friday night seafood buffet ($46 dollar value). The buffet was good and clean, nothing really special but it was FREE! If you get tired of gambling and want a break you can go shopping at the Bass Pro Shop that is located right in/next to the casino. The Bass Pro Shop is huge! We will definitely return to the Silverton on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa95620
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in Vegas. It is so affordable and the employee’s are great! I love this hotel and I even like the fact it's not on the strip. So laid back, but only a 15 minute shuttle ride (if that) to the strip. Couldn't ask for anything more! I have stayed here every year and will never stray!

Reviews.Title: “April Visit”
Reviews.Author: jlcrn1
Reviews.Content: Love the Silverton!! Super staff, great rooms, very good food! We always make it a point to play here, even if we aren't staying here. When we have stayed here the rooms are clean, comfortable and very easy to get to. Staff is very nice and friendly. we have eaten here many times and the food is great!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but don't plan on getting any sleep”
Reviews.Author: aborilla
Reviews.Content: You can read all of the other reviews and get the picture of the Silverton. As for me, I like a quiet hotel, and this place is anything but quiet. The doors slam, so you can hear anyone who enters or leaves their room. Being in a casino, people are up all night doing their gambling/partying thing. So, you have constant noise until about 4 AM. And trust me, you can hear *everything* that is going on. Kinda gross, because you feel like you're sleeping with people you don't even know. Ironically enough, the beds and pillows are super comfy. But don't waste your time trying to sleep, because that won't happen anyway. Bottom line, if you're there to party, this is a great hotel. If you are there to participate in a race weekend like I was, where sleep is precious - go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: run2j
Reviews.Content: They have CLEAN rooms great staff and a fair price for room. We stayed to have one night off the strip and wish we would have spent every night there. The pool was quiet and relaxing such a different experience than our strip hotel. We brought our kids for spring break and wanted the quiet relaxing time. We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Silverton!”
Reviews.Author: Sleepyhollow420
Reviews.Content: Being the "outdoorsy" people that we are, we loved the Silverton. It is connected to the Bass Pro Shop, which is a great place to not only shop, but to just meander through. The Silverton has a magnificent, floor to ceiling aquarium with a plethora of fish. There is a quaint little bar right next to it too, which makes for the most unique and soothing atmosphere. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious. The whole hotel has that "lodge" feeling to it, with fishing and other outdoor activities as its theme. The pool area is beautiful and has several covered couches to relax on. The staff was very nice and accommodating. We will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Casino for a Certain Type”
Reviews.Author: libertychef
Reviews.Content: The Silverton Hotel and Casino is made for those of us who go to Vegas for the sheer purpose of gambling and eating. It's okay, you can admit it. You don't have to say you go there for the shows or clubs. I love the Silverton casino as it has an abundance of the type of machines and tables that my husband and I enjoy. There are plenty of triple multi-denomination Game King machines where you can sit and play various games at your leisure. If you like Mexican food, there's a nice restaurant right inside the casino. The cocktail waitress comes by often and returns quickly with your beverage. There's a Starbucks, and Italian food eatery, Johnny Rockets (which you can order a big, delicious hamburger, take it to your room and watch TV for a break in the action). The parking log/garage is free and is close to the hotel unlike the strip hotels where one must walk quite a distance to even reach the door. So, what are the "needs improvement" areas? Well, they do charge a "resort fee" (this time $8.50 a night). I highly resent these fees. I'm not sure what services they provide---none in my case, as I leave housekeeping a personal tip anyway. Secondly, there is no in-room coffee. So, you have to get dressed, go down to Starbucks, pay $$2.00 for a coffee and go back to your room. Thirdly (and this is only in some cases), don't stay on any floor except the fourth. That way, you won't have anyone stomping around at night and early in the morning. This is the first time, I have had this problem, but I won't let it happen again. When asked if "everything was all right," when we left, we informed them that, no, it wasn't. We were given a little sympathy and some advice to request the top floor, but no monetary refund. I wish there were the perfect hotel in Vegas, but there just isn't. So, you take the good with the bad and so far we like the Silverton the best.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: badvacatopm
Reviews.Content: First off I was so upset with this place I could not wait to get home to write my ridiculously horrible experience. This is the first time in my life evert aking the time out of my day to write a negative review of a business. Pros- hotel was clean, quiet, with plenty of empty slot machines to choose from. Cons- -long wait time at the front desk with only two employees working taking over 20 minutes. -The blackjack dealers have no sense of humor at all. They all seem like zombies and one dealer was gossiping with another player how they are payed minimum wage and the owner is building some type of sports stadium in vegas. Totally unprofessional! -They offer a free shuttle service that takes you to the strip but beware of the driver! We had the same driver two days in a row and cant tell you how rude she was. The shuttle bus makes designated stops but she will tell you that she can take you anywhere "if the price is right." I have worked in the industry myself and soliciting tips is unprofessional and downright offensive. Overall the property is very nice but the employees need proper training and what to and not to say.

Reviews.Title: “Silverton”
Reviews.Author: mlady37
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed four days at the Silverton. The rooms were spacious and mostly nicely maintained. The hair dryer was broken in our room but when we informed the front desk they brought another one right up. The bathrooms were a little small and they unfortunatly had wall paper in them so it was peeling. The new trend for hotels is no coffee pots, refrigerators or microwaves unless you pay extra for them. I feel that if they call them luxury rooms these things should be included. They have wonderful pillow top beds with thick duvets and great pillows. I have a hard time sleeping in most hotels but these beds are fantastic. I slept like I was in my own bed. There is a Starbucks in the casino if you want coffee or a variety of restaurants. We tried the Mexican Cantina and I was very disappointed in my meal (pork chimi - tasted rancid) and could not eat it. They were very nice about removing the cost from our bill. The chips and salsa were great and the hubby's fajita's were good. The Italian fast food was ok but not great. The food had been sitting for awhile and was tough, the marinara tasted ok but was watery. Their menu also displayed a green garden salad but it was not available to order. They" didn't serve that there". Then why was it on the menu? We loved Johnny Rockets the 50's style hamburger joint. The food was great, fresh and hot! The manager was friendly and the service was fast. We didn't get to all their restaurants or bars. There is a large variety to choose from depending on your style and tastes. I would recommed that management kick the food up a notch in the Mexican Cantina and the Italian fast food. There is a large aqarium in the lobby that has live Mermaids several times a day. This seems to be a huge hit with all the children(and all the men) and a lot of locals come to see them. If you are an outdoor enthusiast this hotel is really for you. There is a Pro Bass retail store of humongous proportions connected to the hotel. We are not outdoorsy people but we found ourselves shopping in the store several times during our stay. Clothes, guns and equipment, you name it they have it. An indoor gun range, archery room, waterfalls stuffed animals galore all inside a beautiful lodge style store. This lodge style hotel goes perfectly with the store. There is ample parking and it's very easy to get to off exit 33 on I15. We have stayed on the strip before and hated the constant parking hassel. Parking here was a breeze. I love to work out and was extremely pleased with their fitness room. It was large and clean with a nice selection of machines and weights. Towels and water were provided. There were several televion sets for viewing while working out. It was a pleasant surprise. They have a nice pool with cabanas and tables. Unfortunatly it was too cool to swim during our stay. We truly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a nice place to stay without all the super trendy clubs and headaches. We took our day trips, which included the outlet mall which is just a couple of blocks away, and then we were able to come back , relax and enjoy our evening.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs? Oh my....”
Reviews.Author: JEBIII
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and referred family here. Love being next to bass pro shop. This stay seemed to be another good one until we woke up and my daughter had a bed bug bite on her chin. It was the classic bite with 3 small bites in a row. We couldn't identify any other bites on us. I searched the sheets and around the bed and did not see any but from what I understand that is not unusual as I am not a professional and the carpets and bedding were very dark. We informed the front desk staff and were told there were no other reports of bed bugs at this hotel. We quarantined our bag and clothes nonetheless so we didnt spread the bugs to my mother in laws house. this has been 1 of our favorite hotels to stay in as we pass through vegas. I don't think we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Met Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: audiome
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Silverton Hotel and Casino on the last trip to Vegas. Stayed there because it was off the strip, easy to get in and out by vehicle, smaller so less crowded, and has the Bass Pro Shop attached to the complex. A major item missing is a store inside the hotel for souvenirs of the facility and items like munchies and sodas to take to the room. While there the property was running a promotion so on Thursday and Friday evenings when we returned to the hotel, was hard to get in the main entrance due to the location of the promotion and the amount of people in the smaller space. Food was ok and the cafe a bit over priced for the quality of food served. The big fish tank is cool. Room was quiet and on first floor. If you want the internet, they charge $12.99 for a 24 hour period that I found excessive in cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great great Buffet”
Reviews.Author: lacasa_09
Reviews.Content: This was such a surprise just went for a drive came across this Hotel and it was great!!!!!!!2 41 buffet the food was great service great

Reviews.Title: “Shhhhh---Silverton is a great stay in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: LASLuvr
Reviews.Content: Having been to Las Vegas many, many times--the strip does not have the allure that it once held for us. I'd say that if you make limited trips to Las Vegas or this is a first stay--I'd recommend someplace on the strip--if not, and you're looking for a great place with good value, great restaurants and some of the best and most friendly service in town--you can't go wrong with the Silverton! Why? Let me tell you-- #1--Shuttle service to airport and strip. They have a shuttle that will pick you up and return you to the airport. (No strip hotel will do this unless you're a high roller!) Just wait at the entrance by the aquarium at the scheduled time and the friendly bus driver will pick you. If you're arriving--let the reservations person know that you want to be picked up and s/he will schedule it for you! #2--Great restaurants and you can use your points that you earn on your slot card towards your food! From Mexician to buffet to gourmet--Silverton has it covered. AND they're all good and all resonably priced too! #3--Nice rooms, VERY clean and not a long walk! The rooms at the Silverton are nice--I'd say a bit up from a Holiday Inn. The bathrooms are smallish but everything is clean, clean, clean! They also stock Bath and Body products in the bathrooms! But the best part is that the rooms aren't "miles" and "miles" away from the casino, parking or restaurants like some of the big strip hotels where you walk down the hallway to your room and you think you're almost there and well-- you know what I mean. Also, the rooms are very reasonably priced and if you play in the casino on your Player's card even a little bit they'll send you offers for very reduced rates or even free! #4--Great service. Some of the best drink girls, slot personnel bartenders and waitress/waiters I've ever had the pleasure of being served by! #5--Bass Pro Shops--A Bass Pro shop is attached to the Silverton and points earned on Player's card can be redeemed for gift certificates here. #6--Promotions and Specials -- The Silverton is always running dining, food, buffet slots and other promotions. Check them out on their web page -- http://www.silvertoncasino.com/ The above are just some of the reasons that we enjoy the Silverton but you'll have to try it for yourself. It's a great place to stay and be off strip but still have access to the strip! And best of all--it's a great value in a casino/property that is just the right size!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, Good Price, but wifi is only in the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: AlmostFamousRocker
Reviews.Content: The hotel has made improvements since my last visit.I enjoedy the comfort of my room & the bed was comfortable. The restaurant still needs a more diversified menu with lower prices & better trained employees, who need to learn to smile & greet people properly. The front desk was friendly & some casino staff. The slots were a little looser this timet. Great concerts but poorly managed. They now hold the first two rows for their high rollers & some seats were empty but who is brave enough to go sit there so they stayed opened. The crowd was kaotic & the secuirty did nothing about it. Several drunk women & a couple who needed a hotel room instead of the concert. Very poorly managed concert. And when will they have a shuttle service that provides better hourly service! The new pool is nice. Wifi in the looby w no place to put your computer and poor lighting! Charges are ridiculous for resot fee and wi-fi in your room and the list goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Smelled like smoke”
Reviews.Author: nldevlin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this place two times before, but this time was horrible. We got in late while on the road heading home from vacation. We asked for a non-smoking room and everything was fine until we turned on the airconditioner. Luckily we had some Fabreez with us. It helped for awhile, but I can't toterate smoke and woke up terribly conjested and had some trouble breathing. When we checked out we were given a credit for the $8.00 registration fee that we had to pay when we booked the room on line. We chose this place because the two other times we stayed there the beds and pillows were wonderful like something you would have expected at some luxury hotel. Hopefully this doesn't happen again as we really likes this hotel and will most likely stay there again. If the smoking thing happens again, we won't stay there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice casino, decent restaurants but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Habby31
Reviews.Content: I loved this place after my first visit, they put me in one of the updated ground floor suites and I thought the whole hotel was the same...not so. Of the 3 regular rooms I've stayed in since the first visit they've all been outdated with carpet that should have been thrown out years ago and square tube TV's. As an added bonus on the last visit there was a problem with the AC in my room and the elevators...my room was over 80 deg and the elevators were easily over 100! Not fun. The good, the casino is pretty cool, all the usual games, drink service was decent too. Poker room is the dead zone, of about a dozen wanders by it in 4 visits, there was only games once, so I played the tournament and won :-) Mini bar prices are the cheapest I've ever seen in a hotel. Sundance restaurant is still very good and good value. Most of the staff was excellent. Tough call for this place, but their rooms are in desperate need of updating. I won't go out of my way to stay here again until that happens when I can stay at the fantastic South Point or many strip hotel/casino for the same price Silverton charges for it's circa 1990 rooms. Get on it Silverton! I want to love your hotel but the rooms are hurting!

Reviews.Title: “An OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: lori_s15909
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this hotel because we've been to the casino in the past and really liked the atmosphere. We booked the room online though the Silverton website. We arrived at the hotel around midnight and had an easy check in; the staff was very nice. We were really tired and jet lagged after we arrived. The alarm clock in the room next to us went off for about a 1/2 hour. We called downstairs and they sent someone up and resolved the issue very quickly. We still think that paying $74.00 a night for a hotel room off of the strip was a little pricey for just an okay room.

Reviews.Title: “A just ok casino and lodge”
Reviews.Author: Edward Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel and casino are mixed but the parking from the garage to the rooms is through the casino. A long way to haul bags. the rooms are just ok but the check in staff are good and dispite one of our partys reservation being lost they accomandated them. They even gave us a small discount due to the problems with the reservations and the parking problem. Oh did I mention that the temp was 116 out when we were trying to check in. Ok being it's next to a great Bass Pro shop which you can shop or just walk through. Easy to get to if you don't want to stay downtown. Would stay again but don't carry alot of suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for what the hotel provides and where it is located”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPhoenix_AZ
Reviews.Content: Silverton's has a very nice casino and average rooms, although there was wallpaper pealing from the wall in the tub/shower combination. They do charge for everything. Bottled water is provided in the room, but unless you look carefully,, you can miss the part about it costing $1.75 per bottle. The walk-in price they charged was extremely high, $159.00 a night for Saturday for a hotel that is located far from the Strip. The $59 for Sunday was fair. I think the worst part was that they indicated that this was the best rate available, no AAA rate discount and little assistance when we asked for the business center to see if we could access a better rate online. As we were having car trouble, we had little choice as to where we could stay. After checking when I arrived home, I found that weekend rates were available for $65 on Saturday, and $49 on Sunday. So the front desk was not truthful, and for that I will not stay there again. Otherwise, this is a decent hotel, with decent restaurants. Nothing outstanding to warrant prices such as this. There is also a $14 resort fee tacked onto the daily rate. If you stay there, just be sure to check online rates through both the hotel, and online consolidators such as Travelworm (who specialize in Vegas area lodging), Booking Buddy, and of course, Trip Advisor, which is a wonderful source of information.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay if you love Pro Bass”
Reviews.Author: d.dowse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, on our way through to Yosemite from Grand Canyon, we'd already stayed in Vegas on the way, and my other half hate Vegas, but on seeing this hotel, which is attached to the Pro Bass shop, he was pursuaded to stay here, and loved it. Neither of us are gamblers, so I cannt tell you what the casino is like, but we sat in the bar, had a few drinks, and watched the fish in the huge aquarium next to the bar, which kept us entertained. The room was very comfortable, but I thought it was very dark inside the halls and the room. I do realise they are trying to make it look like a log cabin, but it is very dark. But we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room but UGH, Another Hotel Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: vegasvarment
Reviews.Content: I chose the Silverton for 2 reasons: 1, I've played there before and always wanted to stay there and 2, It's close to the rental facility for early flight next morning. I was recently in Vegas for 9 nights mostly downtown and my flight going home was 7:00 am so I wanted to stay closer to the airport/rental facility. I chose the Silverton also because I had a 20% off coupon from the American Casino Guide. Check in was quick and the registration person handed me a paper for signature and said "you've paid for everything except for the $7.50 resort fee", WHAT! I absolutely despise resort fees and I would not have reserved the Silverton had I known up front. Ok, got that off my chest. Room was very nice, a little larger than I expected with 2 queen beds. I took some pictures and headed down to the casino and soon found out these slots are tighter than my mother's pocketbook! Disappointed that they only had $1 bar top blackjack. Drink service was not good but I did eat at the Mi Casa Grill which was very good. I had the 3 taco combo with pinto beans and rice, excellent. Bed was very comfortable and the hallways were very quiet. I think this is an excellent location for a last night stay in Vegas. I also loved the valet service, very polite and quick even at 5:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: jaks97
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Silverton and the room was nice, with a nice view of the pool. The beds are a little soft and the pillows softer. A firmer pillow would be nice. The restaurants are not bad, but we did order Prime Rib in the cafe area and it was the worst I ever had, even complaining to the wait staff was useless. I do wish more casinos kept the coffee pots in the room, buying from starbucks is a waste of money and at $1.95 a cup for crappy coffee is not good. The casino itself was quite empty and the machines could be a little loser, so we can play for entertainment on money a little longer.

Reviews.Title: “poor access for wheelchairs, especially buffet area. Staff indifferent to needs”
Reviews.Author: lvwheels
Reviews.Content: Casino area okay with some access issues. Inner power doors are a safety hazard as the door opens on you when the button is pushed. Buffet area is in violation of ADA requirments for access aisles. Staff ignores the issue when addressed. In the casino area, children are allowed to run about unescourted in the gambling area.

Reviews.Title: “Sewer Smell Overwhelmed Inside Casino”
Reviews.Author: AVANTI_007
Reviews.Content: Every year after planning working major studio conference my wife and I come to Las Vegas for rest and relaxation. We are Hilton Honors owners and know we can depend on service, facilities, and amenities. This year we came to the new Silverton Hotel because owner Ed Roski is a good man and major contributor in our community. Checked in May 2, 2010. Appeared to be very nice, small, quiet, off the strip. Just what we need for R & R. After dinner we went to casino to play. Having a nice evening. At 10:pm a wave of sewer stink filled the Casino-and it was bad! We were at Flare Bar and I felt sorry for the bartender and waitress’s who were moving about the floor with napkins and hands to their noses. It was so bad I dry heaved several times before dashing to the restroom to throw up. Needlesss to say my night was over. Staff was walking through floor trying to spray freshener but the stench was to strong. People were holding their noses and we were all complaining to each other. I went directly to front desk to talk to the hotel manager only to find that there is none on duty. I was told “…there were major staff cuts and we have no manager”. I was directed to a pit-boss who apparently is in charge of the whole hotel at night….this is at 10:30pm. Pit boss knew the stench and was very understanding. He was receiving all the complaints, doing the best he can with staff and people. He knew how bad it was. He said “…I have already called my manager and alerted them of the problem”. I ask for the manager to call me about my complaint so I gave the pit boss my card and room number. He diligent took all the information down and said he would pass it on to the manager to contact me in the morning. 12:noon-no one called me. I had to go down to the lobby to follow-up myself. Again at the front desk, apparently there is still no hotel manager on duty in the house. Talked with that supervisor, but she had no authority to follow up on my complaint, or give me answers. She went in back to call the hotel manager?? Call where, where is this person? Where is anyone in charge?? She came back and said I could speak with Mike Smith, Supervisor. Mr. Smith was cordial and listened to my complaint. He explained again the “Manager” is off on certain days. Explained the stench was in fact sewer stench. I asked about complaints, and his comment was that mine was “…the only complaint about the incident that we received”. I said that was a lie because the pit boss took complaints, the desk took complaints, and the staff was all suffering. It is illogical that mine would be the ONLY complaint. Bottom line I complained I lost a night of entertainment..and he gave me a complaint form to fill out saying there is nothing more he could do. While Mr. Smith was cordial, he was not helpful and I felt like he had no real authority to do anything or make any decisions. While Silverton is a nice facility, instinct tells me the staff cuts, no managers, and the handling of complaints seem to point to this casino is a big gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Great off strip hotel casino with excellent restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Habby31
Reviews.Content: This is commonly referred to as a "locals" casino which I liked...nice break playing poker with people who weren't drunken tourists...winning the 6pm tournament didn't hurt either. Clean and nicely updated rooms, excellent staff, really nice casino, good bars, a bunch of great dining choices make this place a winner. LOVED the Sundance Grill, great food and great prices. Even the mini bars in this place are reasonable. My only complaint, lose the $15.00 per day resort fee Silverton. Follow Harrah's lead! Most hotels are still charging it but it's sleazy.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: steelers_fan69
Reviews.Content: Off the strip and does seem to have an older crowd, so it is quieter. I didn't think that the hotel seemed full and both nights of my stay I requested extra pillows, but was told on both evenings that they were completely out. The bathroom seemed extremely small.... definately only one person at a time and the fan didn't work. So you either had to shower with the door cracked or die from humidity. We departed on a Sunday morning and met another couple with plans of visiting the buffet. That plan was foiled when we found out that the buffet didn't open until 10 am. We instead went to the Sundance Grill which was terribly overpriced with the worst coffee I've ever had in my life. They do have a mexican restaurant called Mi Casa which was pretty good. All in all, I think I will look for other deals when I return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “4th stay still overall good”
Reviews.Author: Illinoistraveler54
Reviews.Content: First I will say I do like the Silverton. I found my room clean and neat as I have other times. I always get a fourth floor king and this is a non-smoking floor. I like that if it is nice at night the windows open and get some fresh air. I have been using the new parking garage I always go right to the 4th floor and always get a spot near the elevator. I enjoyed the restaurants. There is a nice ham and eggs breakfast at the cafe. Being it was just me I just go up to the counter. I also tried the Italian place and had a decent bowl of chili at Johnny's. I like to eat at the Silverton owned places like the cafe I just use points. I will say the employees I interacted with are friendly. I did for the first time have some slightly noisy neighbors who came in really late or I guess early. But by the time I go to sleep it meant nothing to me. My rooms were comped along with some free play. Now the bad part I had stayed my first 2 nights at South Point as I have for the past 3 trips. They still have lots of good to decent video poker. But Silverton continues to destroy their VP. Last trip I could always find enough decent games to play. No not so much. So be careful if you are a VP player like I am. I may have to consider all 4 next time at SP unless the free play is good enough. Come on give us a little chance. Like I said I do like the Silverton overall.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: dlami
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the area, the food, the camp area. the staff was good at helping and pointing out things and places to go

Reviews.Title: “Cost Reduction Causes Poor Services & Unhappy Clients”
Reviews.Author: AlmostFamousRocker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean but poor location with a shuttle service to the strip available only at 8:00 am and 3:00 p.m. The wait for the restaurant was outrageous and even their wait staff were complaining that the hotel cut staff to save money. The Sundance hostess was rude and obnoxious. The food was terrible and served cold and the prices were outrageous. The slots were tighter than they have ever been...moreso than other casinos. No shops or spa's and/or other salaons anywhere near the hotel. Another sore point..no business center and they wanted 5 dollars to print a boarding pass!

Reviews.Title: “Great aesthetics”
Reviews.Author: jb2186
Reviews.Content: This casino is about 15 minutes from the strip.The themes that took place were very original. You had different themes throughout the casino and it was a comfortable place to be. Music choice was fun and louder so it somewhat drowned the sound of the slot machines. Seating was always comfy, restaurants were all very good with friendly staff. Their player's club was decent-offering a free night's stay the next time you visit, but no big benefits. High speed internet was $10-DONT PAY IT. Take your laptop to the Starbucks for free wi-fi. Rooms were basic, no big perks, walls were pretty thin, bed was not that great, not enough pillows but. This was the first place I lost more then $40 playing craps :(

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: horseshoes
Reviews.Content: Arrived and no help or offer of help with the luggage. My first room faced the parking lot where a large "tent" was being set up for an event. 7:30 start time for the crew. A/C sounded like a B52 taking off. Went to the front desk. They could not have been more gracious and helpful. Moved me to a very quiet room with a more reasonable A/C. (why do hotels insist on those lousy window units?) The room was large, linens and towels very nice and good soap and shampoo. One wall was painted a dark purple and the TV armoir was also purple. Now, purple is a color that makes people uncomfortable, you want to leave your room, preferably to gamble. Enjoyed a great lobster tail in the steak house. Lovely room, good price and great service. Breakfast menu in the coffee shop offered a wide selection and good prices. My server, Betty, was great. She remembered how I had my coffee every morning. When I got ready to leave the bellman was efficient and helpful. All this for about $40 per night. One big complaint. They advertise two-for-one buffet or breakfast. THAT'S ONLY WITH A SILVER OR GOLD PLAYERS CARD. Silverton...you just cheese people off with that. I overheard several people grumbling about that practice. Cheers...J

Reviews.Title: “Silverton Hotel Casino No Precious Metal”
Reviews.Author: traverite
Reviews.Content: Non-suite room well below average...non-working clock...bureau with drawers that fall out...small bathroom...drain stop non-operative...room door did not fully close...toiletries twice not left in room...Wi-Fi a "standard amenity" according to their own in-room literature, but "standard" to this place means "pay extra"...very slow morning service in coffee shop (very)...rude asst. GM...upon checkout hotel manager expressed concern with our problems-then never responded to two fair-minded emails...the Bass Pro Shop, the fish tank, the people on the casino floor--these are the only positives. Otherwise--there are many other much, much, better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Limited Amenities, Check weekend events prior to stay”
Reviews.Author: HFC123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Silverton for an Aloha Festival and was surprised to find that the lodge was completely sold out for the weekend, despite having reservations. Upon check-in, the only room available was smoking rooms. The room was densely profuse with the smell of cigarette smoke. I had to go to a near by drug store to get candles, air freshener, and disinfectant wipes in order to get the room to smell decent enough to sleep in. The hotel also closed the pool early on the Friday, Saturday and Sunday of my stay due to events being held in the pool area. It would have been nice to relax at the pool beyond 3:30 in the afternoon, especially during the hot weather. Housekeeping service was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: Baxter777
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, it's a concert hall. They have loud concerts nearly every night. Outside. Can't watch TV. Can't relax. Can't sleep. The noise goes very late. Avoid this dump at all costs

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeanSigler
Reviews.Content: I was 5 miles from the strip. Quiet. Cheap. Huge aquarium! Manta Rays, Mermaids, huge waterfall, real quiet, big waterfalls, bass pro shop right next door. I'm a wildlife person. I love nature! And this Place has nature and Exotic wealthy living themes! All in one! Nice valet. Protected of course. Good sized pool, enough space where you didn't realize how many people are actually there, and its just quiet. Its great. I think for a lower level room I paid $65? Custom Security Officers, what I did at the time, and they were all wearing Tuxedos. Great place. Downfall is, it does have a casino there as well. A bit ANNOYING if you ask me. But there are plenty of ways to avoid it if you want to. Small little mall near a couple miles out. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “For $69 a night, a great deal.”
Reviews.Author: filmtheory
