Reviews.Content: A brand new three star hotel off the Vegas strip. I would compare it to your average Ramada Inn - nice, but not fancy or showy. Good casino games, places to eat, free parking. Like anything else, if you get a good deal - pay a two star rate for a three star hotel, it's a good deal. However, if I paid $100 a night, I would have been unimpressed. But at $69 a night, it was a great deal. Good option if you want to stay off the strip and sleep for cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Very good buffet at great price”
Reviews.Author: Looooove_2_travel
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the casino, but did go to the Sunday brunch buffet - It was wonderful. In my opinion, many buffets have blan food whereas this casino had more elaborate food (Salmon with cream sauce, specialty chicken dishes, prime rib, crab legs). The decore wasn't my favorite (Think old west, log cabin decore) but the food and service at the buffet were the best I had the entire time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money and location”
Reviews.Author: misnclint
Reviews.Content: First place I stayed at in Vegas was the Plaza. That was the worst place ever. The Silverton is no comparison. Great location, only 2 miles from the strip (they say 7 but that's the center of it I think) and 1 mile from Outlet Mall. I got my room for under $30 a night but now there are new FEES! $5.50 a night that is not optional. They call them "resort fees". For stuff I don't use anyways such as a shuttle bus (I rent a car), Use of in-room safe, Local and toll-free calls (I have a cell phone), Airport shuttle service (I rent a car), Fitness center access (Isn't walking the strip exercise enough?). Pool could be bigger, I think people have bigger pools in there back yard. Overall it was clean, air worked great in 110* weather, kept our room stocked and clean, good atmosphere. Can't complan about the Bass Pro Shop with their 150,000 gallon salt water aquarium. I will stop here but I could go on. Google it if you want to know more, its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be one of the worst in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: swampy2swampy
Reviews.Content: Only one clerk at check in. We had to go downstairs three different times because we couldn't get in the room. The fourth time I asked for and received a new key. It worked. The next evening the key worked and the door opened about an inch. The safety catch at the top of the door had somehow become latched and it took a half hour to cut it off. This happened again after breakfast the next morning. I asked for a new room and they gave us one. The stool was filled to the top when we walked in. I flushed it and of course it ran over. The maid moped it up and in an hour and a half someone fixed it. It ran over again that day . When I asked for comp the manager told me that they didn't do that for natural occurrences. The pool outside was nice.(not the one in the room.) The food was pricey--the front desk is under maned--The bathroom didn't receive supplies each day.--The air conditioner ran constantly. This was really a terrible place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome off-strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikx
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on hotwire for the Silverton, had never been there and it turned out to be one of the nicer hotels I've stayed at in Vegas. If you're looking for something quiet and off the strip, Silverton can't be beat. Also one of the nicer buffets I've had, and only $9.95.

Reviews.Title: “Free Concert, great food? Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-n-Xpert
Reviews.Content: Recently while staying at Silverton Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas I was able to see one of my all time favorite bands and for free! Silverton held a free pool-side concert put on by Blues Traveler. Before attending the concert my girlfriends and I ate at one of the best steakhouses I have been to in a long time. Twin Creeks was located in Silverton and it had great food, great service... couldn't have asked for a better night and we didn't even have to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations.....not so great food”
Reviews.Author: spoiled5
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful, very inviting feeling there. My husband and I like to eat where we stay so naturally we went down to one of the restaurants/cafe and had dinner. The service was terrible, our order was wrong....twice and the food was nothing to brag about. I thought, well, we will try breakfast, I mean how bad can you screw up breakfast right? Well, they did! We ate at the same cafe and once again we had terrible service and just as terrible food. We will stay there again, but we won't be eating there.

Reviews.Title: “rediculous, only one good thing there & thats the bass pro shops.”
Reviews.Author: clbVegas
Reviews.Content: I live in vegas and gamble there alot. I have stayed there several times just because they would comp the room, the rooms are nice. But on three differant occasions I was told that a balieys frangellico coffee is not a compable beverage, that it is too expensive. I dont go for the free drinks, I usually drink a single cola or water. But on three seperate occasions I was in the mood for that particular coffee. They spared themselves the cost of three drinks but those three drinks actually cost them THOUSANDS. Good job!

Reviews.Title: “Silverton Returning Guests Return For Another Silverton Stay”
Reviews.Author: MOJO329
Reviews.Content: We are returning guests of the Silverton Hotel & Casino and we will definitely be returning in the future. The main reason we have stayed at this particular hotel is because of its location off the striip and that Bass Pro Shops is next door. We stayed on the fourth floor overlooking the pool area. Our room was a non smoking room with 2 queen beds that met our family's needs perfectly. The room was clean throughout especially the bathroom. It was promptly made up by the housekeeping staff during our two day stay. Our family enjoyed dining at the Sundance Grill as well as relaxing/swimming in Silverton's pool. However, due to its location you require a car for transportation as walking to or on the strip is a bit of a hike. It is close to the Las Vegas Outlet Center located on the south end of the strip as well as Towne Place Shopping Mall. Another plus about staying at the Silverton, there are no Tahitti Resort timeshare employees to greet you about their offers of show tickets in return for your attendance at one of their timeshare seminars. We have enjoyed our stays at Silverton and intend on returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “After the treatment of the supervisor, we will never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: zamteri
Reviews.Content: We were charged twice for the same room which caused my account to overdraw and were basically told by the supervisor sorry about your luck you will have to wait to talk to accounting tomorrow and see if they can clear it up. We were not offered anything to ammend the situation execpt a I'm sorry. That's it. The situation still has not been resolved.... The only positive experience we had was in the cafe with a waitress by the name of Terri. She was wonderful and the food was amazing. Thank you for that. And since they overdrew my account I was'nt even able to enjoy the casino or gamble since that was the main reason we went there! Thank you for nothing....

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Cabin Feel”
Reviews.Author: justgoloafing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Silverton Hotel for 7 nights. We were pleased with the hotel. The front desk answered several questions we had about the best places to visit within the city. I thought our room was nice and clean. We chose this hotel because my husband loves going to the Bass Pro Shop. We were also a little nervous about staying in a hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “won at silverton”
Reviews.Author: RedRyderMyrtleBeach
Reviews.Content: While on a trip to vegas, went down to "silverton" just south of town on I-15, beautiful and new, hooked in with "bass Pro" so it's a big Lodge type of feel, lots of wood beams and the like, a huge aquarium that was really awesome. Played there for the day and the machines really obliged, I won some nice jackpots here and can't wait to go back. Breakfast was "ok", the coffee shop was nice, the food didn't taste as good as the breakfast I had at "Orleans" or "Arizona charlie's" on Dekature, The only negative thing I can say about "Silverton" is that it has this outdoorsy, country type of feel, and they had just had George Jones there the night before, Charlie Daniels was coming, so my wife and I being country fans thought it would have a completely "country" feel to it, but we were very disappointed at the music they played the whole day we were there was some kind of bad "Pop" sounding stuff, it wasn't bad out in the casino because it wasn't as loud, but in the coffee shop it was so loud it really interferred with breakfast. Take a hint from "Sam's Town", if you're going for the "country" thing, then go ahead and go all the way, don't try to be everything for everybody, won't work. We'll visit again, but please think seriously about piping some real country music in there 24/7 and I believe in the long run you'll be better for it. In fact if you'd had "country" music playing we would be staying at "silverton" next time, but won't unless we hear you've changed your music selection. When I go to "hard rock casino" I plan on hearing "hard rock" that's fine. If I go to "Bellagio" I'm probably not going to hear "country". But if I go to "Sam's Town", "Arizona Charlie's", "South Point", or "silverton" I expect to hear good country music.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: HannahBanana1972
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Silverton. Had 3 rooms booked, one for my parents, one for my brother, and one for my husband and I. Pros: Beautiful huge lobby, stunning massive aquarium, Pro Bass Shop is incredible, casino is large but not large enough to get lost, casino had lots of game choices, beds were very comfortable with nice linens, toiletries products were very nice, rooms bigger than average and room decor was nice. While playing slots, cocktail waitress were around constantly taking free drink orders....that was nice. The "Twin Creeks" Steakhouse is exceptional, one of the nicest dinners we have ever had out, excellent staff, food was amazing....but be aware it is closed Sundays and Mondays. Check in was friendly as was the little souvenir shop's clerk. A large convenient Starbuck's is located in the hotel, as well as a pizza/hamburger place that was impeccably clean and had inviting, friendly staff. Casino ventilation was quite good so it never got too smokey. Cons: Complained to housekeeping 1 minute upon entering room because bathrooms were actually DIRTY....toilets were dirty, garbage in garbage can, etc. All three bathrooms were not in good shape, needed recaulking around toilet, new grout on floor tile work, shower/tubs were dingy and the floor of the showers were very slimy....ICK! Floors are uneven in areas which is quite strange. The "Sundance Grill" restaurant was so bad it was ridiculous; from unfriendly boring staff to terrible food quality! Seasons Buffet for the Sunday Bellini Brunch was nice, but for regular during the week buffet breakfast it was pathetic (no eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, or other traditional breakfast foods, but instead egg rolls, salad, pizza, perhaps not what you want before 10am?)....buffet was VERY grubby, food subpar. Alcoholic drinks throughout the entire hotel and casino were outrageously priced ($45 U.S for a margarita and 2 rye and cokes!!) Rooms for the most part were quiet...but be advised that if you have a room with an adjoining door to another room, you can hear WORD FOR WORD what the people in the other room are saying (not so fun if they are super early birds like we had next to us). Front doors of all hotel rooms are needing to be replaced, as they are ALL damaged in one way or another. Bartenders in Mermaids Lounge could have used a class in friendliness. Location is very poor if you want to be where the nightlife and strip are.....but a great location if you want to be away from the strip and want it quieter yet still fun. Don't expect a great shuttle service.....they offer 3 shuttles a day to the Ceasar's Palace (11am, 5pm and 10pm). You have to figure out how to get back to the Silverton yourself. We never used the shuttle because we thought the times were inconvenient. Cab to the strip costs between $22 to $25 one way. There is NO shuttle to and from the airport....cab from the airport is about $20. ATM machine in hotel charges a $22 fee per transaction....yes you read that right...so make sure you get cash somewhere else. NOTE: This is important!! If staying here, go and get your Discovery Club card from within the casino....usually I don't bother with these things because they are just a gimmick, but there was zero hitch with this....it gives you amazing drink and food discounts and buffet was half price with the card. ANOTHER IMPORTANT NOTE: Only 3 minutes away is the new "SouthPoint" hotel and casino....its gorgeous, its massive, and the Silverado Steakhouse there served us the nicest meal we have EVER had in a restaurant.....12 oz. lobster tails broiled to perfection, amazing prime rib, roasted asparagus with decadent white wine hollandaise sauce, delicious salads prepared table side, and an excellent/professional/friendly waiter and staff. SO, pros and cons to this hotel......but to be honest we will stay at the Paris or another we are familiar with on the strip again. The Paris is lovely to stay at, and so is the Monte Carlo. The Aladdin was amazing to stay at as well, but it is now called the Planet Hollywood and looked loud to us. Enjoy Vegas!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay now, but in a few years...”
Reviews.Author: laribee
Reviews.Content: 3 nights spent here, we noticed for a new place (parking garage still being finished), it's going to have serious problems. Tub/shower were dingy looking, beds were hard, floors don't feel entirely level, drywall tape lines showing. They spent more on the bar fridge and safe than the TV's-most old hotels upgraded to flat screen, here they only have them in the bar/downstairs. Restaurants not finished, the one that was operating took an hour to send food to us, due to my foolishness of ordering during the 10pm shift change. Staff forced pleasantness when they weren't fighting among themselves, no coupon discount books like many hotels offer. The price was right though, if I spent more than $50 a night here, my review would have to be harsher... :) To their credit, the fish tank is the coolest part of the downstairs, mermaid lady visits each night. And they supply that sexy coconut/lime shampoo I love so much. I'd likely give it another try, hopefully it will be finished by the next time we go there, but the rooms that have already been built are going to need remodelling by then.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: heyhey71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silverton for 2 nights in September '08. The trip was very last minute so wasn't expecting a nice room. Our group consisted of 3 adults and 2 kids (2 and 3). The room itself was ok. However, we were looking at a wall from the window and the a/c was very loud. Do not trust the shuttle service! It only runs like 4 times a day!! It is impossible to get taxis at this hotel, we waited for more than an hour twice in 2 days! Finally the staff was nice enough to give us a ride! We had friends staying at the Oasis RV park which has a shuttle service to and from the Silverton, this RV park was nicer than the hotel! I wouldn't recommend the hotel to families with small children. The highlight for the kids was the huge fish tank in the lobby with real mermaids. The restaurants were ok and the Bass Pro shop was very nice. The worst part of our stay was that after we had left the hotel we noticed that most of our cash (several hundred dollars)had been stolen from the room. I know we shouldn't have left it there but still is was very well hidden and one certainly had to look for it!! The hotel investigated but of course nothing was found!!

Reviews.Title: “could not be worse”
Reviews.Author: rich0976
Reviews.Content: after having this hotel recommended by a neighbor who is a regular customer,i booked five days at 49.per day, the room was dark and gloomy only marginally clean.i mentioned this to housekeeping but nothing was done.after two days during which i had played a conciderable amount i decided to stay another two days i went to the desk and was quoted a price of 290. per night for the extra two days as i felt that the amount of play i had given them already should or would get me a comped room,or at least a casino rate at most casinos i have delt with as a regular casino patron over the last 40 or so years. i asked to see a host ,this man and the manager he then called were without a doubt the rudest casino employees i have ever encountered. i told them i would leave immediatly as they felt so little of my patronage, they would not allow this insisting i would have to pay for that night ev en if i left ,it was approx 3 pm at the time.they had charged the entire five days up front so we stayed that night ,playing in another casino ,and moving to another hotel for the remaining four days of our stay the next morning , i am still waiting for the refund promised for the unused days.i will never stay ,or allow anyone i know to book a room in this casino again.

Reviews.Title: “WILL Go Back”
Reviews.Author: smokininkman
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many property's, both local and strip in the past. first time at the Silverton. Stayed for 3 days Had a fantastic time. Great Hotel. Wonderfully nice people. Got into town early, at 10AM, and got right into our room. The bed WAS to die for. Best nights sleep I have ever had in a hotel. Thick plush pillowtop matress, perfect pillows, VERY nice linens. PLUSH towels in bath, oversized. I wouldn't turn down a free stay at some of the "fancy high priced "strip resorts, but if my pocket has to pay the bill, Silverton in my choice from now on. Great Mexican restaurant. Very impressed. Coffee shop is on par. Buffet is a typical buffet. Good decent food. WONDERFUL desserts. Just an overall perfect stay. Thank YOU Silverton!

Reviews.Title: “A little like the original Strip hotels”
Reviews.Author: IowaFloridaTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel-casino is a little bit like the original hotels on the Strip, but it's a couple miles to the south. It's just 4 stories tall and has big parking lots all around -- and with room specials that are like the early days too! (We got a "half-price" special plus $75 rebate for gas through Expedia, which worked out to less than $15 per day for 4 days, including the taxes!!!) The hotel gave us a few coupons good for a breakfast and other discounts, too. Signing up for their players' club got us discounts on the buffet as well. The casino was large and clean and the air wasn't too smoky even when it was busy. And you can play some of the games for less than at many of the large hotels (50 cent roulette chips, for example). Our room was nice but the view was limited because it was on the third floor. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: ironicisme
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay just one night before moving on to the Venetian. Received an good offer from Silverton and decided to check it out. Arrived on Sunday, 8/31/08 and was given a smoking room [with no ashtrays???] with 2 Queen beds. Room had a "rustic" appearance with blurry pics on the walls. Bathroom really small with bottles of water you can purchase for $4.00?????? Bathroom shower curtain was filthy with mold. Beds were uncomfortable. Called housekeeping 3 times to supply ashtrays...no response. Finally grabbed some from the casino and brought them up to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay But?”
Reviews.Author: Airhawk17
Reviews.Content: I just finished a stay at the Silverton Casino. I have been to vegas to many times to count and decided a stay at Silverton would be a nice change. Valet can be a bit slow depending on the day and events that are in the area. Self Park was very convient if you decided to go that route. A super target and all the other stores that follow are just across the street. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. We were able to check in at 900am with no problem. At check in we were given some very good coupons from booking through expedia. You will need a rental car at this location. The decor was rustic and had a disney wilderness lodge theme which was very cool. The pool was one that you would find at a community center. It is very plain, but peaceful. The room was very nice, the beds were the most comfortable bed that we have ever slept on in vegas, The ac worked great. The bathroom is the problem, it is very very small. There is no room for two peolple. It is nice just small. The bed bath and beyond soaps and lotions were a nice touch. Mi Casa is a mexican rest. at the resort, it is great, ask what the special for the day is. We saved 50% by ordering this way. The buffet was excellent, our expedia coupons allowed both of us to eat crab legs for $9.00 total. They were great and even better at $9.00. Our las night we ate at Twin Creeks Steak house. This place was EXCELLENT, it will cost you around 120.00 four a couple, but it was worth it. The Bass Pro Shop is attached to this resort so you can go price your favarite rifle and then play Blackjack to earn the money to buy it. I will never stay anywhere but Silverton Casino. The following are negatives that we encountered from other locations this trip. NYNY has massive construction going on inside, jack hammers were so loud you could not here delaers talking to you. Tony Romas Steak and Lobster at Fitzgeralds was a joke, the lobster was good but the steak was like eatting shoe leather. Traffic on the strip was very heavy, use I15 to skip it. $$$$$$This is am must$$$$$$$$$$$$ Go see Jersey Boys, buy the cheap tickets and they will move you closer up front. It is a great story line, and songs were excellent. The "F" word and "GD" was used alot during this show. This show would of been perfect had they just not used the language. The silverton allows you to dip into the "strip confusion" and then retreat to your private resort in peace. This is a country boys Four Seasons. if anyone has anyquestions you can email me at flytoyougirl@yahoo.com I am no vegas expert, but been there many times and know the do's and don'ts.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but a pleasure to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: josh1231
Reviews.Content: I am just finishing up my 4 night stay at the Silverton. I haven been very impressed overall. Rooms: the rooms are nice and comfortable. They are not fancy, but they are clean. The t.v. is a 27", and also is nothing fancy but it gets the job done. The rooms are clean, and the beds are pretty comfortable. Not as comfortable as at home, but they get the job done. Although I couldn't get the wireless internet to work, they had a network cable plug in, and the network connection was very fast. Casino: The casino like the rooms, is nothing fabulous, but it gets the job done. It is nicely laid out and has a lot of different options. Table games are plentiful, though it is very possible you will be the only person playing. I was playing double deck $5 blackjack and it was just me! The poker room is pretty bad. I was only actually able to play 1 time as there was never enough people to play. There is a lot of choices and the casino was not overly smoky in my opinion unlike some other posters said. Hotel Services: The valet was a tad lacking. They were never very busy, but it took quite a bit of time (15 minutes) on average to get the car. It also took some time to drop off your car because sometimes there were no valet employees around. Still much quicker to get your car than at a mega resort because there aren't 100 people in front of you, and the workers worked hard, just seemed to be a little understaffed. Room service was average, nothing great, but the price was good. It was very iffy at night whether or not you would be able to get food. One night when I called at 1:00 a.m., nobody answered so I called the front desk. They said "Oh they must not be at their post call them back in 5 minutes". So 5 minutes, then 10 minutes, then 15 minutes later i called, and was never able to gety anything. Business services were non existent, and if you want a boarding pass printed you have to have the front desk do it since they don't have a business center. Dining: We only ate at the buffet and room service. Buffet was very good, especially the sunday brunch. We were very impressed, and for $16.99 you got a very good buffet with unlimited champagne drinks like mimosa's. The dinner buffer was $19.99 and with it you got unlimited house wine. As I said earlier room service was good, if unspectacular. Good value for the money. Location: I really liked the location. It's very convenient to I-15. If you are not going to rent a car though, DO NOT STAY HERE. I always get a rental in Vegas, and have no idea why you wouldn't get one. If you don't I would not stay here. Would probably be at least a $15 cab ride to the MGM one way, if you could get one. I never saw one out front. They have a shuttle, but it only goes every 5 hours??? I don't know why they bother, every 5 hours? They're only 10 or 15 minutes from the MGM, so why they couldn't go every 1 or 2 hours, I don't know. I think it boils down to the running theme of the hotel, which is that they are a tad understaffed. Overall: I really like this hotel. I know I mentioned a lot of negative things about this hotel, but I would definitely stay here again. I paid $40 a night including tax, and for that price I wouldn't stay anywhere else. It has a few problems, but the rooms are clean, the employees friendly and the food is good. I also really like the location, but make sure you get a rental car. I stayed at the Venetian and Signature MGM Grand my las two times to Vegas. This place obviously isn't as nice. But for the money, it definitely is great. My wife and I are coming back to Vegas in February, and this will be where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: runningman5k
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 6/7 to 6/14 on the 4th floor. Room: Clean and comfortable. Bathroom a little tight for 2 people (or even 1). Maid service was excellent. Pool: The outside area is under construction but open. Decent size, not crowded. Hot tub a nice feature as well. Gym: Nice small workout room outside the casino. Has all the essentials: treadmill, bike, elliptical, some weights. Casino: A bit on the smokier side but nice. All of the standard games. Slots were relatively loose and had good luck on the tables. Dining: Coffee shop was not the best. Service was fair and food was not very appealing. Buffet was OK. Mexican restaurant was good. Extras: Bass Pro Shop and the aquarium are awesome! Overall, this hotel is an excellent budget option to staying on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rscarter05
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Silverton Hotel and Casino. We were in Las Vegas for a concert, but didn't want to pay the prices of the Strip hotels. We paid $75 a night and were very pleased. The room was nice and clean, loved the Bath and Body Works amenities. Parking is abundant and you never have to walk too far to your room. We enjoyed shopping at the Bass Pro Shops which are attached to the Hotel. We loved the convenient location. Just minutes from the Strip, but far enough to miss the crowds. The Premium Outlets are very close by and have great shopping deals. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Mermaids at Silverton Casino”
Reviews.Author: caddypaddy
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay at the Silverton. I met friends there. I stayed at the Bellagio. I went for it all!! But I LOVED the Silverton, Everyone there and everything from food to gambling was comfretable. 5$ tables for craps and all even on Saturdays. The place was new with a rustic feel. The new vegas is over priced. Go here to get a little old town feel. Then check out the money casino shows too. Have a blast! Check out the Mermaids in the tank too!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay In Vegas Without All The Hype”
Reviews.Author: dieterbean
Reviews.Content: we were going to vegas to see def leppard at the palms. the palms was out due to the cost---way too expensive to stay there! so, since we are not interested in gambling, we just wanted a a clean, comfortable, inexpensive place to stay for the trip. our last trip to vegas we "gambled" on the "riviera" which proved a bet we lost. (see my review on that place) anyway, we decided to take a chance with silverton, and i am really glad we did! silverton is easy to get to (is is about 3 miles south of the start of the main strip) and for once, we did not have to walk from one end of the place to the other to get to where our room was---usually the casinos seem to have it so you have to walk through the length of the casino (and drop some cash) on your way to your room. the room was exceptionally clean! and, though i have not had a response from them yet, i emailed the silverton to ask what brand bed they have----i had the most comfortable nights sleep that i have had in ages! ( i would really like to purchase the brand that they stock at their hotel for our house) we didn't have time to hang around as we were busy going to our show and such, but we did see the aquarium which is really nice and i think they also have a "mermaid" show daily. the only drawback of the silverton would be shower flow---it needed more pressure. that room cost us $78.00 and change---$1.00 under what the motel 6 was charging---i would stay here anytime. both people we dealt with at check-in were very pleasant and treated us with friendliness and respect. next time we come to vegas i would definately stay at silverton--they have proved themselves to be a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: donz2
Reviews.Content: We had a first floor, non-smoking room but due to the quantity of smoke from the casino, everything in the room smelled smoky and you were hit with the smoke as soon as leaving the room. The pool was closed and construction was in progress, so any relaxing by the pool was out of the question. It would have been much more considerate of the Silverton if they would have informed us ahead of time of this. The shuttle to the strip runs every 5 hours, so plan ahead if you fly in and you're not considering a rental car. No public access computer/internet so bring your laptop and plan on an additional $11.49 a day if you want to check your e-mail. I know I'm out of touch with such things, but $4 for warm bottled water seemed a bit excessive, too. We stayed 3 nights. Room service after the first night made the bed--didn't even empty the garbage. After the second night it appeared they cleaned the room. I'm trying to think of anything positive to report but I'm having trouble. Since I'm not a big gambler, I can't really comment on the 'gaming experience'.

Reviews.Title: “Great Buffet”
Reviews.Author: casinocim
Reviews.Content: I did not stay here just visited the casino. I really liked the casino. There is a Bass Pro shop connected to the casino. So if you are not winning you can look around there. They have daily fish feedings which are fun. The buffet was very good and at a reasonable price. Lunch was $8.99.

Reviews.Title: “Gambling at the Silverton”
Reviews.Author: cinleer
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed in the hotel, but not everyone goes to a casino just for the hotel room, so I wanted to talk a bit about the casino itself. My husband and I discovered the Silverton last October when we were looking for a free Craps class. Turned out I had gotten the day of the week wrong, but they did have a $3 Craps table at 1 in the afternoon, so we decided that we could afford to throw some money at learning a new game. We have since been back three times to play both Craps and Roulette, and let me tell you, the Silverton by far has the most friendly, entertaining dealers of any casino I have been to. The dealers took plenty of time explaining the betting process and how to place our odds, and everytime we have been in since that first day we continue to learn more from the dealers there than at the other casino's we have played at. My husband and I don't frequent the larger, more expensive casinos due to our budget, so we are always looking for the $5 tables, and even on weekend evenings, the Silverton will have more than enough $5 tables for you to get on. I highly recomment letting the ladies and gentlemen of the Silverton teach you how to play craps if you are looking for something new to learn while in Sin City.

Reviews.Title: “Good off-strip hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you don't want to be on the strip, and it is a great stay for the sports enthusiasts. There is a Bass Pro Shop connected to the hotel (looks like a lodge), and the casino also hosts a huge fish tank. They had divers feed the fish and had a host describe the different fish and their habit. There are several Orange County Choppers also on display. Our room looked just like the picture linked here on the TA web site, and the service was excellent. This is a small hotel (only 4 floors) which in comparison to the large strip hotels added to a more relaxed and less congested casino. The Seasons buffet and 24 hour restaurant both had numerous selections, and the food was good. For a change of pace and for a stay away from the strip, this is a hotel to consider for your next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: apinney33
Reviews.Content: We actually found this place by accident, but it was so nice! The restaurants are pretty reasonably priced for Vegas. They offer complimentary wireless internet which is almost unheard of there. They also offer complimentary shuttle service to both the airport and the strip. It's right off the south strip actually and very near an outlet mall with some killer stores in it. It's also attached to a Bass Pro Shop, so if your guy is an outdoorsman, watch out. It was a very nice stay, although I think there ventilation system was a little messed up as it smelled like smoke part of the night in our room, until we turned the heat up, then the smokey smell left.

Reviews.Title: “Great to be away the strip”
Reviews.Author: simonkklee
Reviews.Content: You must have your own car to stay here. The price is good considering it was during CES (about US$100 per night) and no queue at the check-in. One problem was that I requested by email and a telephone call directly to reservations about a NON-SMOKING room and they failed to deliver. The receptionist recommended that I should have called on the day to request the NON-SMOKING room. Got a smoking room on the level 2 and surprisingly it didn't smell of smoke so we didn't change the room. The room itself was big enough. Hot water was good and everything else was in place. Wireless internet had a problem and called the technicians and they turned up in about 20 mins even at almost 1am. However, they looked at my computer and said "sorry... it's a technical problem with the server. try again tomorrow when we will have fixed it hopefully" and left. They could have told me that the wired connection was hidden at the side of the TV and I could have plugged that in to get to work. Overall a clean room. Casino is friendly enough but there are a lot of youngish guys playing who make sure everyone knows they are there and playing. There was even a fight while I played poker which was quickly sorted out by Sean the manager who kicked out two guys quite efficiently and correctly. Welcome to Las Vegas! Location was OK if you have a car. Easy self-parking and very close the Las Vegas Car Rental Centre. Overall... an excellent stay and will most likely stay here again. The atmosphere is very local which makes a good change from the strip and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: jlcrn1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night at the Silverton. Room 4095. Not a great view but oh so comfortable bed. Nice decor...rustic but very clean. A/C kept room nice and cool. Room safe, iron/board,fridge all worked well. Quiet at night and we were near the elevator. Staff very pleasant and friendly. Great buffet...good food and very attractive dining room. Although it is at the far south end of the strip, we had a car and getting about was no problem. They have changed the entrance way about and it was a bit confusing at first but we got the hang of it quickly. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBrit
Reviews.Content: Silverton is a lodge themed smaller hotel-casino to the south of the main Las Vegas area. Though the rooms were refurbished a couple of years ago, it seems the plumbing was not attended to. Our non-smoking room on the 4th (top) floor had a parking lot/freeway view. The walls were dark brown, with brown carpeting, brown bedspreads, and brown draperies, resulting in a dimly lit interior. A sad looking petrified plant stood next to the television cabinet and a huge picture of a bear stared down at us as we lay in bed. The wall air conditioning/heating unit beneath the window was so noisy you couldn't sleep with it left on. The room and bathroom were very clean, but the shower never worked efficiently even though maintenance installed a new shower head to replace the old leaky one. Water pressure was little more than a light sprinkle. The casino didn't seem to pay off very well from what we could see, and from our own experience. The continuous background "soul" music in the casino seemed out of place with the rustic theme. Employees were pleasant and helpful. Security was practically non-existant. Parking was plentiful. However - the recent road "improvements" have resulted in a maze-like, confusing entrance from the freeway. When there are so many more attractive, competitively priced, hotel/casinos in the area (e.g. the South Point across the freeway and the brand new Sun Coast in Summerlin), we are not likely to return to stay even for free nights.

Reviews.Title: “Outdoors theme extremely comfortable atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: DakotaDodge
Reviews.Content: The Silverton is just a few minutes South of the Strip and it is extremely comfortable. It has an outdoors theme and is connected with the Bass Pro Shop. The room was very nice, contemporary, and very richly done. I'm not a fancy or hoidy-toidy guy, so the theme fit my personality. The casino was not as crowded as those on the strip and everyone was nice--from my fellow gamblers to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Silverton !!!!”
Reviews.Author: tommmy
Reviews.Content: There is not enough room here to say how GREAT our stay at the Silverton Casino was. First of all we arrived early (11 AM) and asked if we could check in early, they checked and sure enough "No problem" they said your room is ready. WOW !! We couldn't believe it. From there it just kept getting better, the pool was quiet and relaxing, plenty of chairs and towels. As for the gambling, they have a great small (compared to the vegas mega casinos) but complete casino (Sports book, table games and plenty of slots). The servers there are great as well, always friendly and quick to get you a drink. The food at the Saturday night buffet was top of the line. Now if you are thinking of staying here remember, this casino is not on the strip (it 's about a 5 minute drive there) so just keep that in mind but to me it is so well worth it. Oh yeah to top it off we asked for a late check out (to get a little more pool time in), No problem we were able to check out at 1PM.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfinn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location for the first or last night of your trip to Vegas since it is fairly close to the airport and car rental facility. We received two offers from the Silverton Hotel and Casino for a $29.99 room and a $39.99 room for one night. We reserved the rooms over the phone about a month ahead of time for the Laboe Day trip. We were in Vegas for eight days, but only one night at the Silverton. My sister, her husband and kids were traveling with my husband and I, and his parents, so we gave them one room while we stayed across the hall in the other room on Wed., Aug. 29th. We have stayed at this property several times in the past and have always enjoyed our stays. We had two beds in our room and they were fairly firm, while my sister had two much softer beds. The room was non-smoking and it didn't smell like smoke until you walked out into the hallway. This is probably due to our room being on the ground level a few halls away from the casino. You probably won't have that problem if you're on a higher floor if smoke is an issue. The rooms are very spacious, as well as the bathrooms. They were refurbished a couple of years ago, so the fixtures and decorations are updated. While we were there, we showed everyone the aquarium which is pretty neat and spent a little time in the casino using the coupons from the American Casino Guide. The Bass Pro Shop, which is connected, was closed since we arrived late, so we didn't go there on this trip. We have been there several times and it is a fairly large store with everything you would find in the Bass Pro's at home (we are from Missouri). They do have souvenier Bass Pro t-shirts and you can find a 20% off of any one item discount coupon in the free What's On Magazine around town. There may be one in your room upon arrival, so make sure you check it before heading to the store. There are lots of other coupons in that magazine as well. My sister and her family left early for the Grand Canyon, while we stayed in Vegas since we had been to the GC a few times. They grabbed breakfast at a IHOP, which is fairly close. We ate lunch at the Silverton buffet, which is much better (and more expensive) than the buffet of the past. We had a buy-one, get-one free coupon from the American Casino Guide, so the price was reasonable. Check-in and out of the hotel was very easy. We gave the front desk a $100 cash deposit instead of having them put a hold on our credit card for incidentals since we were on an extended trip. The pool looked very nice, and there is a workout room, but we didn't have time to use either. We will definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Well ,Okay for one night”
Reviews.Author: pimmy80
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in this hotel durring the way back to Utah . It was nice hotel ,Staff was ok. Smell better than some hotels. But the gym was so small . I like the soap and shampoo set in toilet . The food was okay . Good price for hotel in this city I dun have problem with staff service but compare to the country I am from I think it is a bit far from I expected

Reviews.Title: “Vegas' Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: TheBedels
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a week for 2 rooms at the Planet Hollywood and when we arrived the price had doubled, so we stayed 2 nights and then moved to the Silverton for the rest of our stay. The Silverton is where we will stay in any future trips to Vegas. The rooms were just as nice and for $100 could be upgraded to a fabulous suite and this still beat Planet Hollywood's price by more than $100. for just a room. The staff was so friendly, the restaurants were great, the suite was to die for. While there they also had a poolside concert by the Desperados ( A Tribute to the Eagles). The aquarium with the mermaid swimming was a nice addition to the lobby. The only drawback is that it is 5 miles south of the strip and no shuttle, so it is either a cab or the bus, which was a hassle. I love the Silverton!

Reviews.Title: “Silverton Casino”
Reviews.Author: MelissaLynn74
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten path, the Silverton Casino has been here in Las Vegas for 10 years, and I only just recently made a trip there. Its located off of the Interstate I 15, its about 7-10 miles from the Strip,. but if you have a car, its TOTALLY worth the trip! The gaming is very good, from what I experienced... you get a long play time for your money. I like the penny machines, and if you can get long play time with the pennies, well- you know thats good news. My family and I especially enjoy the fish tank there. Its thousands and thousands of gallons, with tropical fish, some sharks... its very, very nice and of course, the best part is that its FREE. They also have a store called the Great Oudoors, I believe and it is IMPRESSIVE. They have all kinds of taxidermied (is that a word) Animials, Moose, Lion, Giraffee, ducks, fish... you get the idea. Its just amazing. You can get ANYTHING there if you love the outdoors, hunting, fishing, camping, boating, swimming... all the good stuff. The store is enourmous and it even has a kind of shooting range... with electronic squirrls that fall down when you hit them, sound effects, the whole works. Its fun! Dont miss the Buffet there, its beautiful- look up when you are in there and see the HUGE trees they sliced to use as decoration... really pretty. The food is wonderful and as buffet's go, first class, totally. The staff is excellent. My Son wanted a hamburger and that was not something they had in eye-sight, so I inquired as to if that was something that we could get and the Chef went to one of the resturaunts and got one and made it especially for him! (We tipped him $6 bucks, hey, he coulda said No) I havent explored the whole of the place, not that its that big, but the atmosphere of the Silverton is very, very nice. Extremely clean and I like it very much. When my parents come to Las Vegas this August to visit, we will be taking them there. Cheers! MelissaLynn

Reviews.Title: “F- and that's being nice! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: llazyk
Reviews.Content: Dirty room, dirty sheets, bad food, terrible service, and it's not easy to get to the strip. That pretty much sums up my 3 day stay. I complained about the dirty sheets and room service came up three hours later to change them, leaving the dirty comforter with blood stains on it. So after that fiasco I wanted to play some craps but it was to late so they only had one table with dealers that didn't evn know how to play the game. I wanted to play at a real craps table so I tried to get a cab to MGM, I waited for an hour and finally got one. It cost $30 to get to the strip from teh Silverton after they told me it would be $10, no big deal though at least I got to play in a real casino.. I will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Silverton is a terrific value”
Reviews.Author: Roger_Mars
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Silverton several times, my opinion here is based on my collective experience. I am a fan. I have read through some of the negative comments posted by others and can only offer that as a frequent LV visitor, I have had good and bad experiences at most all places I have stayed. It's the nature of this extremely high guest-traffic city. Silverton rooms are spacious, well appointed, and feature several small touches I really appreciate, such as a CD player, dimmers on all lamps, a curved shower rod, and a nice cushion top mattress. The only negative I can offer is that the A/C is a built-in wall unit, rather than a central-type. Although it has an adjustable temperature control, it is not digital and there are only 2 settings on the fan. The fan is sort of loud and annoying. That being said, I usually sleep well through it. There is a mini-bar in the room. The aquarium is the best I have ever seen in my life. It's awesome. The nearby mermaid lounge has a tank of jellyfish behind the bar. There is a Bass Pro Shops for outdoorsmen (and ladies). The Sundance Cafe is a very good coffee shop. Again, service is spotty all over vegas. Usually its good here. I actually like sitting at the large granite counter when I am alone. Note to breakfast fans: Opt for the traditional hash browns over the other potatoe choice. I like "Joe's Shuffle" which is scrambled eggs with spinach, onions and turkey sausage (plus potatoes and toast) for $5.25. I have not tried the Buffet or Steak House. The Shady Grove has excellent Happy Hour specials (4-7 M-F), like $2 Grey Goose shots, while the new Mexican restaurant has $1 Patron shots and $2 appetizers. The staff have always been friendly to me. Good Bloody Mary's while I was playing on Sunday. The pool is large (unheated) and usually quiet with few kids screaming and splashing. I have used the hot tub at all hours. They do have concerts at the pool area in summer. You can relax in the water and see the band. Please note that it's a drive to the strip (approx. 5 miles) but if you want to stay off-strip or just want a really good value, this is it. Join the club and use your card. I get extremely low rates as a result and I am by no means a heavy player.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: kp5981
Reviews.Content: First we booked a suite and they didn't have any left and they still charged us for a suite. I was in town for my friends B-Day and we were playing Baccarat and there were 5 or 6 people playing. The dealer didn't like the language that was being used so security came over. Next thing I knew the kid across from me that didn't even say anything was on the ground being beat by security. It made me sick! I checked out and went to another hotel that night. Beware of this casino, their rooms are not nice and security will beat you up for sitting at the baccarat table.

Reviews.Title: “Good Visit and Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: kimberly35042
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a 4 nights at the Silverton in September of 2006. It is hard to find a good rate on a Saturday night in Vegas unless you gamble (A LOT) and Silverton gave us $89 through Cheaptickets.com which I thought was a really good price. The rooms were clean and well kept and bathrooms were large. I also liked the aquarium. The casino itself is a little dark and the pool was large but plain and hardly anyone ever there. All in all, I'd stay here again.I think their video poker was rated best for locals by LVA.

Reviews.Title: “the buffet”
Reviews.Author: bmfox
Reviews.Content: On 5-2-07 I visited the buffet with my wife and 2 friends. After we were all seated it took the server at least 10 minutes to come to our table and get a drink order from us. After bringing drinks back he never cleared the dirty dishes from our table. I finally got the asst. manager and told him the problem, he got us drink refills and after the asst. manager did this we never saw our server again. I manage a buffet on the las vegas strip and if I had a server treat gueststhis way they would not be working for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds & Toiletries”
Reviews.Author: Annie70
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through Vegas at a rate of $44.00 for a Thursday night. I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. We were looking for just one night's good sleep outside of Vegas for our family, and boy, was the sleep great.! The beds were very comfortable and the room was oversized. The hotel was easy to find from the airport using mapquest directions although at the time (September 2006) there is construction going on in the area, so watch the signs and the traffic. It's a little tricky. The parking lot was a little confusing going just one-way in spots and finding the front desk was a challenge. I know it's a casino and you have to travel that maze to get to anything, but it's still a pain--especially with two little kids in tow. We did not come to gamble and cannot comment on anything like that except to say that I hated dragging them through the smokey casino. But I knew this when I booked the room. I would not stay here on a long term basis for this reason alone, but for one night after a 7 hour flight, the spacious rooms and comfy beds were worth the quick entrance and exit. The hotel is attached to a Bass Pro Shop and the area between the store and the casino has a huge fish tank that periodically features a live "mermaid" which was the highlight of our 4 year old little girl's stay. She got to see "Ariel" who was tastefully clothed in a mermaid suit that had a flesh colored suit underneath--so you weren't really seeing what you thought you were seeing. A plus for us prudes. She swam with stingrays, small sharks and other fish and even came to the glass to interact with our daughter. Our room was ready when we arrived around 1pm local time. It was oversized with two queen beds with heavenly pillow-top matresses and very comfortable pillows. We were on the 4th floor which was supposed to be non-smoking, but there was always a faint odor of smoke, possibly rising up from the casino or other floors. Our room did not smell as if it had been smoked in. The room was clean, spacious and cool in the 90 degree heat. The air conditioner worked great, but was a bit loud. We did not mind and did not need to use our white-noise machine. But if you like quiet, it was loud. The drapes darkened the room well when we went to bed early because we had come from a different time zone. Our room overlooked the pool which was lit up beautifully in the dark, but we did not swim. Did I say that the beds were fabulous? Better than any $40 hotel I've ever stayed at. Come to think of it, I don't think I ever did stay at a $40 hotel before! But book through Vegas.com to get a better price than you can get through their regular website. Rooms at this price are limited so book early if you can. The bathroom was average and included a hairdryer, but the bonus was the Bath & Body Works toiletries. It was a nice touch. No cheap hotel soap here. I would definitely stay here again if I was coming through town, there is a lot of room for the children to move around in, a table to have dinner at (only two chairs) and a Bass Pro Shops next door. I believe they have an RV Park too and several restaurants which we did not visit. Just a short drive away is the very bottom of Las Vegas Blvd. and several places to eat and a grocery store. We also purchased a double CD containing about 16-18 songs that was in the room for $12.99 which seemed reasonable. It was a nice variety of music from Aretha Franklin to Sonny & Cher, Captain & Tenille to Bonnie Tyler. It did not seem overpriced as many hotel items are. Speaking of which, there were $6 bottles of Evian and a mini bar available, but we didn't even open them up. I would not stay here long term simply because of the faint smell of smoke (we are asthmatics) and because the children had to walk through the casino to get anywhere, but it is a VERY comfortable place to stay after a long flight, passing through or for adults only.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: jwjones
Reviews.Content: Stayed in rm4032 on 9/13/06.Quiet,comfortable and clean room.Shuttle to strip.Located in safe area for a good price and value.

Reviews.Title: “off the strip cheap rates without comprising quality”
Reviews.Author: lasvegaschick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are a fairly young crowd for this hotel (28 and 31). Majority of the crowd seemed a little older and more mature looking to gamble without all the action and chaos of the strip. What drew us to the casino were the cheap rates. My husband and I come to Vegas often and were a little tired of paying the high costs of rooms on weekends so we decided to try a hotel off the strip. For those who are looking for cheap rates at a nice joint (because honestly, the only time you spend in your room is to sleep and shower so you can hit the casino again) and taking a short drive to the main strip isn't too much of an iconvenience, I would reccommend this hotel. The rooms are comparable to any main strip hotel, all the amenities etc. etc. etc. Have some more money in your pocket to gamble with, rather than paying for a big name casino!

HotelInfo.Name: Silverton Hotel and Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 3333 Blue Diamond Rd., Las Vegas, NV 89139
